texts.en: Ruth Bina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more avon and personal collection products to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from buying and selling dry goods. Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en: Victorina is 61 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Victorina has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle. She has been in this business for 7 years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 30 years of age, married to Silvester, and blessed with two children ages 10 and 2. She runs a retail business she started nine years ago and earns a monthly income of about KES 85,000. 

She wants to restock her business and has requested a seventh loan of KES 100,000 to purchase cooking oil, different juice flavors, packs of rice and sugar. The profit from her business will help her to purchase a piece of land. Peninah's dream is to one day own a vehicle and rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, juices, packs of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child. For the past two years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of about KES 5,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000. 

He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbike as well as to purchase additional spare parts. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his child as well as invest back into his business operations. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he would improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To repair and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married businessman whose wife earns additional income for the family by growing and selling vegetables. John has seven children who are currently studying. His main business is buying sheep and selling them at a profit. This has been his business for the last four years. He repaid his previous loan successfully and has asked for another loan to expand his current business. With the accumulated profits he can pay school fees and manage his family well.

loans.use: to buy rams and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. This is her first loan.

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, water biscuits, oil, sugar and slippers.

Rosita opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to the poor people and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt and water

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Virgilia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Virgilia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, rice, spices, vegetables, etc., for her food vending business.

Virgilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, spices, vegetables, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man who has been working in his convenience store since October 2011. Ali is well-known in his region for his good reputation and hard work.

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to install a glass display door in his shop. He is facing strong competition, so he has to set special offers and sell a very good quality of products in order to attract new customers and meet his existing customers' needs.

Ali is working hard to keep his store number one, and he hopes to expand it into a wide supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To install a glass display door in his shop

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 25 years old. He is single and supports two people, who are mainly his younger siblings. He runs a motorcycle transport business also known as a "boda boda". He has been in this business for the last four years and from this business he gets an average monthly profit of 12,000 KES.

Timothy has borrowed a loan of 60,000 KES which he will use to purchase a new motorcycle to expand his business. With the anticipated profits, he will use them to expand his business as well as pay school fees for his siblings.

Timothy's dream is to expand his business into a car hire or taxi service company. With this, he will able to meet his family's financial needs more consistently.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Mtende

texts.en:
Mtende is 29 years old, married and a father of two children. For the past two years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 

Mtende was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES. He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbike as well as purchase additional spare parts. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his children as well as invest back into his business operations. 

Mtende's goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses so as to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Joyce

texts.en:
Ma. Joyce works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past 12 years.

Ma. Joyce has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like hotdogs, meat, and chicken for her food production business.

In the future, Ma. Joyce would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Maribeth works very hard to provide for her family.

Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years, selling a variety of items such as detergent, soap, canned goods, sugar, milk, and snack foods. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed, 19 years old, lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a grocery store. He is well known and has many customers. He is a hardworking and very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead. He was helped to establish his business by his brother. He likes to stay ahead of the competition.

He wants to see his business grow and be an absolute success. It is for this reason that he has decided to request a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy soft drinks and canned food for his business. He knows that in this way he will be able to provide his household with a better economic situation. He hopes to increase his profit to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and canned food for his business

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro es habitante de la bella ciudad de Estelí reconocida como el diamante de las Segovia ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua. Estado civil es casado tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Este varón se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos valores morales entregado a su familia.

Es su tercer crédito con CEPRODEL y manifiesta que han sido de gran impacto en su familia ya que de esta manera ha mejorado su vivienda.
Actualmente es trabajador de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desempeñándose como fontanero desde hace nueve años.

Con este monto financiado lo va destinar para compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc y perlines ya que va realizar mejora en el techo de su vivienda.
Teodoro se manifiesta agradecido con kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que va ser posible mejorar su vivienda y dar mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Teodoro lives in the beautiful city of  Estelí, known as the Diamond of Segovia, in the north of Nicaragua. He is married and has two school-aged children. Teodoro has worked as a plumber for a water and sewer company for nine years. He is an upstanding man and role model for his family. 

This is Teodoro's third loan with CEPRODEL [Centro de Promocion del Desarrollo, or Center for the Advancement of Local Development] Local and he says that the previous two loans have helped his family greatly as they financed home improvements. Teodoro will use these loan funds to purchase construction materials such as zinc and beams to repair the roof of his home. He is grateful to Kiva for the support it has provided, which allows him to make home improvements and provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as zinc and beams.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia, ella tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es ser profesora, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal como para la educación de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
María del Carmen was born 34 years ago in the city of Paucartambo. She lives common-law husband and their children. 

María del Carmen is a teacher and very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who supports her family by working diligently each day. The “Llapallanchis Llankasunchis” communal bank invited María del Carmen to become a member because she's so responsible. She is applying for a loan and will use the funds to pay for her children's education. María del Carmen is grateful for the bank's support and considers the loan crucial, so she is determined to make her monthly payments promptly.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of wholesale meat (pork and beef).

loans.name: Maribel De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maribel de los Ángeles de 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos pequeños de hijos, uno de 5 años y otro de 8 años. Habitan en casa propia desde hace ya 8 años con esfuerzo y dedicación ha construido su hogar ya que quiere que sus hijos tengan una casa para vivir tranquilamente. Es una mujer con muchas virtudes ya que a su poca edad es admirada por muchos por su forma de ser y dinamismo que la caracteriza.  Ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tamales de pollo y su esposo le ayuda  trabajando como motorista en una almacén de nuestro país es así como se gana la vida honradamente. Ella desea construir una fosa séptica y como no tiene los suficientes fondos para hacer esta construcción se acercó a FUSAI para realizar un préstamo espera contar con la ayuda necesaria pues desea completar ese deseo que tiene para que sus hijos evitando así focos insalubres en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maribel de los Ángeles, age 23, lives with her husband and their two small children.  One is five years old, and the other is eight years old.  They have lived in their own house for eight years.  With effort and dedication she has built her house because she wants her children to have a house in which they can live peacefully.

She is a woman with many virtues.  When she was young, she was admired by many for her nature and for being known for being dynamic.  She makes and sells chicken tamales.  Her husband helps her by working as a driver at a warehouse in the country.  That is how they honorably earn a living.

She wishes to build a septic tank.  Because she does not have sufficient funds to do so, she approached FUSAI for a loan.  She hopes to have the needed help.  She wishes to fulfill this desire so that her children will avoid unsanitary conditions at their home.

loans.use: to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia de 57 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad desde hace 10 años, siempre con alegre y con visiónes y deseos de superación, se ha rebuscado por como sobresalir en la vida siento una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, audaz y perseverante en lo que le corresponde hacer. Ana Julia es viuda y por eso le toca a ella llevar el sustento diarios a su hogar jamás se ha dejado vencer al contrario siempre ha sido admirada por muchos vecinos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, y además vende carne, cada mañana se levanta va al molino, corta la carne y prepara para en la tarde estos están listos para ser comercializados es así como ella se gana la vida honradamente posee de abundante clientela y esto la hace sobresalir de los demás. Ana Julia desea construir una fosa séptica, pues tiene un servicio sanitario que está dañando que puede generar problemas de salud. Es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la construcción de esta. Cuenta con muy buena referencias.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is a 57-year-old widow who has lived in her own home for ten years. She has always been content and had ambitions and visions of improving her life. Ana Julia is a hardworking, entrepreneurial, bold woman who has sought ways to get ahead and approaches whatever she does with determination. 

As a widow, Ana Julia has to earn a living each day. She has never shirked her responsibilities and has earned the admiration of her neighbors. Ana Julia prepares and sells tamales and also sells meat. She wakes up each morning and goes to the butcher shop, where she cuts meat and prepares it for sale in the afternoon. Ana Julia earns an honest living, has distinguished herself from her competitors, and gained a large customer base. 

Ana Julia wants to install a septic tank as the plumbing in her home is damaged and poses a health risk. She is applying for a loan from FUSAI for septic tank installation. She has excellent references.

loans.use: to install a septic tank.

loans.name: Cristian David

texts.es: Cristian de 18 años de edad, un joven con deseos de superación, siempre con visiones altas para sobre salir en la vida, vive junto a sus padres en casa humilde pero propia. Es muy atento siempre le ayuda a sus padres su madre que tiene una tortillería y su padre trabaja en una milpa como agricultor. Además Cristian posee un trabajo en una telefonía del país instalando cables de televisión y línea fija. Cada mañana se levanta con esa ilusión de trabajar duro para que a sus padres no les haga falta nada el día de mañana. Cristian desea construir una pila nueva para recolectar agua suficiente para sus padres, ya que la que posee es pequeña y se encuentra en mal estado es por eso que solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad, espera construirla y más adelante seguir apoyando a sus progenitores.
texts.en:
Cristian, 18, is a young man with high goals and the determination to improve his situation.   He lives with his parents in a modest house which belongs to them.  He is very attentive and always helps his parents.  His mother has a tortilla business and his father works as a crop farmer.  Cristian works for the national telephone company installing TV cables and landlines.  Every morning he gets up to go off to work enthusiastically because he wants to provide for his parents so they are not lacking in the future.

Crisitian wants to build a new sink so his parents can collect greater amounts of water since the one they have is small and in bad condition.  He is requesting a loan through FUSAI to cover this need.  He hopes to build it and continue supporting his parents.

loans.use: To buy a new sink.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 58 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Aurelia is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Aurelia has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a used shoes business in the Philippines for 10 years.

Edilberta has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used shoes to sell.

In the future, Edilberta would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Loida has been in this business for 7 years now.

Loida has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Etelia Marlenys

texts.es:
Etelia, requiere de un nuevo prestamo porque necesita mas capital de trabajo para continuar con la elaboración de pupusas o antijitos; hoy en dia cuenta con una tienda en la cual invertira dicho prestamo, este le 
permitirá comprar los productos básicos del hogar, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, papel higiénico, jabón, detergentes, bebidas, entre otros.
Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Etelia needs a new loan for working capital to continue making pupusas (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) and other traditional corn-based dishes. Today she has a store where she’ll invest this loan. This loan will allow her to buy basic household goods such as beans, rice, sugar, salt, toilet paper, soap, detergent, drinks, etc. The family’s financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, salt, toilet paper, soap, detergent, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en:
Murtaz is 65 years old and single, living in the village of Dzveli Abasha alone. His only source of income is a small-scale agricultural business. He cultivates a plot of land where he grows nuts and maize.

With the requested loan, Murtaz will purchase an electric counter and pay for a work permit to serve as a local joiner. He owns all the machines he will need in order to do so. Murtaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an electric counter and pay for a work permit

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 41-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working in a mouneh (food preservation) business for five years.

Sanaa is a hard-working woman who puts in so much effort to provide her family with the best healthy living. She is responsible for six family members, so she has to make sure that her business develops properly by expanding her working region, diversifying her products, and increasing her production and sales.

Sanaa specializes in preserving mulukhiyah. It is a species of green leaves used as a vegetable. It is generally eaten cooked, not raw, and is most frequently turned into a kind of soup or stew. She also specializes in preparing tomato paste and grits.

Sanaa has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with special products from the current season's produce. She hopes to develop her business by responding to more customers' needs.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with special seasonal products

loans.name: Dinora Yaneth

texts.es: Dinora Yaneth de 50 años edad vive junto a su esposo y su pequeña nieta. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que es admirada por sus vecinos porque ven el carisma del que esta hecha y la forma de ser, se dedica hacer modista, cose ropa, arregla ruedos, hace camisas y pantalones esta es la forma como ella se gana la vida honradamente. Dinora es muy visionaria y siempre ha deseado lo mejor para su familia es por eso que en esta ocasión se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un préstamo así podrá construir una fosa séptica e instalación del servicio de agua potable; está muy contenta con esta idea y desea cumplir su sueño lo antes posible,ella cuenta con excelente referencias de pago.
texts.en:
Dinora Yaneth, 50, lives with her husband and small granddaughter.  She is a hard-working woman who is admired by her nieghbors because of her charisma and demeanor.  She is a seamstress and earns a decent living makes clothing such as shirts and pants.

Dinora is a visionary and has always wanted the best for her family.  That is why she is requesting a loan through FUSAI so she can build a septic tank and install a drinking water service.  She is very happy with this idea and hopes to meet her goal as soon as possible.  She has an excellent credit record.

loans.use: To build a septic tank and install a drinking water service.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo por la calidad del servicio y la forma de pago que la Institución brinda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar productos necesarios, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, bebidas, golosinas, jabón, entre otros.
Cuenta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar las ventas y tiene mejor su inventario de mercadería. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: José is requesting a new loan because of the institution's quality service and loan terms.  He will use the loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, drinks, sweets, soap and other items.  He says the previous loan helped increase sales and improve his inventory.  His family's economy and situation have improved.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, drinks, sweets, soap and other items.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Con Talento Group

texts.es:
DÚO Mujeres con Talentos 
la señora Deicy Leticia de 32 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa típica de forma ambulante y como actividad secundaria vende cosméticos.  Tiene 10 años de vender y actualmente le han hecho varios  pedidos de güipiles típicos de Marcador y sus clientes le han pedido mas mercaderia y ella no tiene el capital suficiente para invertir, Por tal motivo ella necesita nuevamente hacer otro crédito para no quedarles mal a sus clientes y aprovechar esta venta para poder obtener bonitas ganancias y agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en: Duo Mujeres con Talentos (Two Women with Talent) Deicy Leticia is 32 years old. She travels on foot to sell traditional clothes, and as a second job she sells cosmetics. She’s been a salesperson for 10 years. Right now she has orders for traditional blouses from Marcador. Her customers have ordered a lot of merchandise, and she doesn’t have enough capital for the investment. For that reason she needs to obtain a new loan so that her customers don’t become unhappy with her and so that she can use these orders to earn more money and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has four children.  She is 29 years old. 

Sofia is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, Coca-Cola fish canes and oil. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt and Coca-Cola

loans.name: Manjola

texts.en:
Manjola is an Egyptian Albanian and is photographed here with her husband, Naim.  Manjola is 28 and together they have two children, 7 and 5. The older of the two was supposed to attend public school, yet they claim that is very difficult due to their lack of an adequate income. They live in a town of approximately 10,000 residents in northern Albania. 

Manjola and Naim collect and sell scrap metal and plastic and they have been doing this activity for almost five years. The factory complex that they sell to is not far from their town; thus, they consider themselves lucky that they don’t waste fuel for the transportation vehicle seen here in the photo.

The loan that Manjola is requesting now will be used to pay for the scrap.

loans.use: to pay for scrap metal and plastic to resell

loans.name: Isabel De Maria

texts.es: Isabel de María de cuarenta y cinco años de edad madre soltera vive junto a su pequeña hija de nueve años, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tamales, pasteles, yuca y papas, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda, es muy conocida por las personas del lugar; Isabel es una mujer comprometida, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor, con la llegada de las lluvias en las ultimas semanas aumentó el deterioro de su vivienda y desea repararla, necesita cambiar el techo pues el agua se filtra y les ha provocado mucha incomodidad y para mayor seguridad de su familia ha tomado la decisión de repararlo, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde  por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar la lámina galvanizada para el techo. Isabel de María y su familia estará más seguros dentro de su vivienda.
texts.en: Isabel de Maria is a 45 year old single mother who lives with her young 9 year old daughter. She sells tortillas, tamales, cakes, yucca, and potatoes. The business is located her home and is well known locally. Isabel is committed to her work and very hard-working. Every day she works her hardest in order to have a better life. The arrival of the rains in recent weeks hastened the deterioration of her home, and she’s decided to fix it. She needs to repair the roof since water has leaked in, and its made her family very uncomfortable. She’s made the decision to fix it for the security of her family, but she doesn’t have enough money for the repair. For that reason, she’s asked FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets for the roof. Then Isabel de Maria and her family will be far more secure in their home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheet to repair her roof.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha cuenta con 60 años de edad, esta acompañada. Ella vive junto a sus dos hijos y un nieto; su compañero de vida reside en los Estados Unidos. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la situación económica de su familia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales de construcción para construir una fosa séptica y un baño. Su máximo objetivo, es terminar de construir su casa y reunirse nuevamente con su compañero de vida y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 60 years old and has a partner. She lives with her two children and a grandchild. Her life partner lives in the United States. She never had the chance to study because of her family's economic situation.

She is asking for this loan from Fundación Campo to buy construction materials to build a septic tank and a bathroom. Her ultimate objective is to finish building her house and to be reunited with her partner and all of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a septic tank and a bathroom.

loans.name: Lolo Jin Group

texts.en:
Lolo Jin is a group composed of four Lebanese women, who are acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to improve their living and develop their businesses.

Doha is the featured borrower of the group; she is a 31-year-old single lady who has worked as a political programs producer for National TV for five years.

She is preparing for her wedding, and that's why she is acquiring a loan to pay for her wedding preparation needs. Her business is going on just fine, but she has to develop it more through future applied-for loan that will help her centralize her own production company.

Doha is the lady with dark pink shirt. As for the other group members, Aida is the first from the right wearing black, Rana is the second from the right, and  Lolo is the first from the left with the white dress.

loans.use: To pay for her wedding preparation needs

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which has helped him to to paint the inside and outside of his house. With the previous loan, he was able to renovate his old house, thus having the opportunity to improve his family's quality of life. 

Now he is requesting a second loan to build an additional room onto his current home since his son has gotten married and would be living there with his new family. Bajram will use the money to purchase gravel and to pay for the renovations.

His goal is to provide a secure life for his family. Bajram again would like to thank all of the Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: To purchase gravel and to pay for renovations

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and comes from Olkalou. He is married to Beth who is a farmer and they have five children aged 24, 21, 19, 16 and 14 years old.

Peter is in mixed farming, which he has been running for the past 15 years, and he has applied for a loan of Kshs. 25,000 from KADET Ltd, his fourth loan, and he intends to use it for buying farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

Peter has plans for using the anticipated profit for repaying his loan as well as paying school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a single man of twenty-five years. He supports his mother who is also a farmer. He does pig rearing and also keeps poultry in Kangemi and has been in this business for seven years now. Samuel gets a monthly income of nine thousand shillings.

This will be Samuel's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy fifteen piglets.

In future Samuel wants to start a grocery shop as a means of expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen pigs

loans.name: Ibanda Carpenters Association Group

texts.en:
Ibanda Carpenters’ Association is located on the outskirts of Ibanda Town. The group is comprised only of men who make all kinds of household items.
Francis is a single father  who lost his wife in a car accident in 2011. He has five children and also takes care of his sister's two kids because their mother failed to provide their basic needs.

Francis runs a small carpentry workshop with capital of UGX.200,000. He also runs a small retail shop, all of which he does single-handedly. He intends to use the loan money to construct an improved workshop for his carpentry business. He will use some of the money to add stock in his retail shop and the balance to pay school fees for his children.

His main challenge is harsh weather conditions which affect him while working due to poor housing, and thieves who steal his timber at night. Despite all the challenges, Francis is a very hard-working and determined  man, who wants to send his children to good schools and provide them  with the basic needs.

loans.use: To buy building materials for constructing a workshop

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man aged 50 years, supporting 11 members of his family. Richard is blessed with five children aged between 17 and 5 years. He owns a general store and has been in the business for a period of six years, earning an income of KES 22,000.

Richard is servicing a sixth loan of Kes 120,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase more stock of cooking oil, washing detergents, and wheat flour among other goods for resale.  The profits he earns will be used to pay school fees and other home basic needs.

His dream is to prosper both in life and business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, washing detergents, and wheat flour, among other goods for resale

loans.name: Elkin Humberto

texts.es: Elkin, con 36 años de edad, es casado y padre de cuatro hijos. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas gracias a las  enseñanzas de su padre y sus hermanos mayores; debido a esto, hoy en día posee cultivos de fríjol, arveja y tomate de árbol, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside; esta actividad es la principal fuente de sus ingresos familiares, con los que solventa todas las necesidades básicas del hogar. El prestatario es un hombre con empuje, que lucha incansablemente para sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente solicita un crédito con la intención de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, fungicidas, pesticidas y fertilizantes), así podrá darle continuidad a su negocio y darle mejores cuidados al cultivo para que la cosecha pueda ser más productiva; esto le ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos y podrá seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una parcela propia, donde pueda tener sus cultivos y generar mayores ingresos para garantizarle a su familia una estabilidad económica, para continuar dándole a sus hijos una buena educación y mejorar el nivel de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Elkin, 36 years old, is the married father of four children. He has lived in the countryside his whole life, where he learned to work in agriculture thanks to instruction from his father and older siblings. Thanks to all this, he now has bean, pea and tree tomato crops. The harvest from these crops is collected and sold in the marketplace of the municipality where he lives. This work is the main source of income for his family, with which he provides for all of the household's basic needs.

The borrower is a man with drive, who works tirelessly to help his family to get ahead. He is currently asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale agricultural inputs (seeds, fungicides, pesticides and fertilizers). In this way he will be able to maintain continuity in his business, and to better care for his crops so that he has a more productive harvest. This will help him to increase his earnings. He will continue fighting to achieve his dream of having his own plot of land, where he will grow his crops and generate better income to guarantee his family's economic stability. This way he will be able to continue giving his children a good education and to improve the whole family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (seeds, fungicides, pesticides and fertilizers).

loans.name: Estrella Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLA AZUL” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Benita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de huevos, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, tejido de mantas a máquina, hilado de lana de alpaca, costura de deportivos, costura de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Benita es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de su anterior trabajo, donde aprendió la técnica de tejido, posteriormente decide emprender su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, el crédito y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Estrella Azul” (Blue Star) is starting it second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Community Center.  This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Benita as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling eggs, selling foods, weaving blankets, weaving blankets by machine, spinning thread from alpaca wool, producing sportswear, and producing jackets.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Benita.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house.  Benita currently has a business of weaving and selling blankets.  She gained knowledge about this business from her previous job where she learned her weaving techniques.  Afterwards she decided to open her own workshop.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vicuña wool that she will acquire in bulk at the traditional fairs.  She will then use the material to make what she sells from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family.  Benita is married and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Benita said that she enjoys the savings, the loans, and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool in bulk.

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal  “Club De La Amistad” conformada por 09 socios dedicada a distintas actividades de comercio. Siendo  Leonarda una de las integrantes. Hace más de 10 años que Leonarda se dedica a la venta de comida en las afueras de un colegio, siendo la gran mayoría de sus clientes alumnos de dicho colegio. Como actividad segundaria se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores (cuy, pato, gallina). Solicitó el  crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio la cual comprará toldos,  mesas y de esta manera brindarles una mejora atención a sus comensales.  A sus 66 años Leonarda se siente con todas las energías de seguir trabajando. Leonarda es viuda  con 03 hijos independientes. El grupo “Club De La Amistad” agradece el crédito brindado. Leonarda se encuentra en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado derecho viste blusa blanca y casaca azul.
texts.en:
The “Club De La Amistad” Communal Bank is made up of nine members who are engaged in different commercial activities.  Leonarda is one of these members.

For more than 10 years, Leonarda has made a living selling food outside a school; thus must of her customers are students at the school. She also raises small animals (guinea pigs, ducks and chickens) as a secondary activity. She applied for a loan so she can continue investing in her business. She will buy awning and tables and in this way provide her diners with better service. At 66 years of age, Leonarda feels she has all the energy she needs to continue working. She is a widow with three adult children.

The “Club De La Amistad” group is grateful for this loan. Leonardo is in the back, the third from the right, wearing a white blouse and blue jacket.

loans.use: to purchase awning and tables.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Es Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
Dúo DIOS ES MI GUIA
Iris Aracely quien tiene 22 años de edad se dedica a la confección de blusas para damas y niños en diferentes tallas y colores, tiene 4 años en el negocio y está muy agradecida con Dios por la madre que le regalo ya que todo lo que es y lo que sabe, se lo debe a ella. Tiene varios pedidos de blusas por docenas que es la venta que realiza, pero la tela que tiene no le alcanza y desea comprarla por rollo que es donde ella ahorra mas obteniendo mejores ganancias, cada rollo está valorado en 800.00 cada uno y utiliza de 6 a 7 colores en la confección de las blusas.  Por tal motivo ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar otro crédito para poder satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes y así no quedarles mal a las personas que confían en ella.
texts.en:
Duo "Dios es mi guia" member Iris Aracely is 22 years old and makes shirts in different sizes and colors for women and children. She has been in this business for four years and she is very grateful to God for the mother he gave her, because everything she knows she learnt from her. 

She has several orders for shirts by the dozen, which is what she sells. However, the fabric she has is not enough and she wishes to buy it in rolls, which is when she saves the most and makes more profit. The rolls cost 800.00 each and she uses six to seven colors when making the shirts. This is why she finds herself in the need of requesting another loan in order to deliver her customers' orders and not disappoint the people who trust her.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 30 years old, single mother of two children who are 10 and six years old.

She selling clothes in Naivasha and has been in business for six years.  Hannah applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy more clothes to resell.   She plans to pay school fees and to buy more stock of clothes with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Hannah hopes to open a boutique in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 39 years old married to Josphine and they have two school age children.

Harrison has an animal feed and husbandry shop in Naivasha which he has operated for four years.  He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. to add stock of animal feed to his business. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and educate his children.

In the near future, Harrison hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to add stock of animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to start a business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 30, is married to Joseph and a mother of two children.  She runs a beauty salon in Kangemi and has been in this business for five years.  Alice earns a monthly income of 20,000 shillings.

This will be Alice's second loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the loan to buy a two burner gas cookers for home use. 

In future Alica wants to own a bigger salon and raise her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy two gas burning cookers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 50, is married to Alice and a father of four children.  He operates a welding fabrication business in Kihara on the outskirts of Kangemi.  He has been in this business for 20 years and earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be John's eighth loan with KADET LTD.  He plans to use the money to buy rods for welding. 

In the future John looks forward to opening another welding shop as a means of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy rods for welding.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 30 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Rebecca did not go to school because she has lived all her life in the rural area of Sanniquelle. Rebecca is married to a farmer. They have six children, ages between 10 and 14. All Rebecca's children are in school since they now live in the city of Sanniquelle. 

Rebecca says she received a little money from her mother to establish this cook shop (restaurant). She spends 10 hours on her business. The problem she faces is small income. Rebecca is requesting this loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc., for this business. Her plan is to one day own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc., for this business.

loans.name: Genifer

texts.en:
Genifer is a 40-year-old lady from Shirere in Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports nine people in her family and is married to Meshack. Together they have six children who are 28, 22, 18, 15, 13 and 8 years old.

Genifer has a small-scale retail shop. She has been operating this business for the last 17 years and generates a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has applied for her first loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more items like salt, cooking oil, washing powders and other shop commodities. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

Genifer's dream is to start a wholesale shop to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to add stock to the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture and equipment for his business.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria is a 39-year-old lady from Shirere in Kakamega county in Kenya. She supports eight people in her family, being married and blessed with five children who are 20, 17,  and 14 years and twins who are 9 years old.

Valeria operates a motorcycle transport, a business she has been doing for the last three years, generating a monthly income of KES 16,000.

Valeria has applied for her first loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to do repair for the motorbike so as to put it in good condition. She will use the anticipated income to expand the business.

Her dream is have a stable business in the transport sector and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Dúo Monte Horeb Group

texts.es:
DUO MONTE HOREB
Este dúo está integrado por doña Blanca, quien es la líder y nos cuenta que solicita este nuevo crédito para invertir en su tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace 30 años, además tiene un molino y dice que necesita comprarle algunos discos ya que los que tiene ya están gastados y valen un poco caros entonces espera que kiva la pueda apoyar con su credito para invertir en su negocio, además quiere comprar golosinas y artículos de consumo diario como maíz, frijol, sopas instantáneas, pastas, jabones etc.
texts.en:
Blanca's the leader of Dúo Monte Horeb.  

Blanca says she's requesting this new loan to invest in the store she has had in her house for 30 years.  She also has a mill and needs to buy some discs for it because the ones she has are worn out.  They're somewhat expensive, so she hopes Kiva can help her with a loan to invest in her business.

She also wants to buy sweets and staple items such as corn, beans, instant soup, pasta, soap, etc.

loans.use: to buy food and discs for her corn mill

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. He has five children and has been doing agricultural work for eight years. His primary income sources are eggs, tea, crops and transportation services.

He says the most enjoyable part about agriculture is that he can earn a living.  His biggest challenge is a lack of market.  He wants to purchase a dairy cow.  Animals on his farm have not been given names.

Robert was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "the low interest rate and customer friendly."  Robert also says that the micro-finance training session he attended was very client friendly.

His highest monthly expense is school fees.  When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Robert replied, "Improve living standard."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Robert owns the following: poultry and a motorcycle, household mosquito net, solar power, TV and DVD player.  Robert's how does not have electricity, running water or a sewing machine.

Juhudi Kilimo tries to measure any change in living standards based on its loans.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is a farmer who lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a bananas and sugar cane growing region. He has three children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry, tea, dairy farming because I get food and get income out of my sales." His biggest challenge is "Lack of enough income to cater for my needs and to better my farming." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Nyabarati."

Zachary was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Lower interest." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and he said, "How to save and how to manage loans."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Zachary replied, "Improve our lives."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Zachary owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia was born 1980, and she has lived all her days in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

She is a seventh grade dropout. She and her boyfriend are living together along with four children, ages between 1 and 13. Three are currently attending school. 

She was able to establish her business with small money from her boyfriend. She has sold vita, onion, oil, pepper, salt, etc., in the local market for three years now. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours on her business. The problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita, onion, oil, pepper, salt, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, onion, oil, pepper, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mayada Group

texts.en:
Diala is the featured borrower of the Mayada group.  She and her neighbors and friends got together to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. 

Diala is the lady sitting at the center of the picture.  She is a 32 year-old married mother of four children, responsible for six family members including her husband. 

She works as a tailor to help cover her family's expenses.

Diala's portion of the loan will be used to buy underwear and children's clothes to trade.

The other group members are, Mayada standing at the right side in the picture and Mona is the lady on the far left.

loans.use: to buy underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Alicia, La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de ferretería, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende pinturas, clavos entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas para su negocio.

La socia que sale adjunta a la foto  pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de regalos, ferretería, tienda de abarrotes y artesanía.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Urpis de Confraternidad” which is located in the District of Cusco, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Alicia is one of the members.  She continues to manage a hardware business, which she has done for years.  Alicia is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work.  She sells paints, nails, and other items that her customers request.  Alicia wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy paints for her business.  

The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late because of work reasons.  The other members engage in businesses such as selling gifts, managing a hardware store, managing a grocery store, and making handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy paints to sell in her business.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 40 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru.  He is married and blessed with five children who attend school.

Elijah has been in the farming business for ten years and he has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd. after paying his previous loans on time. He intends to use the loan amount to buy a cow. 

With the anticipated profit, Elijah plans to buy sheep to increase his livestock.

Elijah hopes to grow his farming business and make more income to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 31 years old and lives in Sanniquillie, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. She did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in the rural area. She is married, and her husband is a security man. They have two children, ages 9 and 12. Her two children are in school. 

From her susu (local daily saving) she was able to establish her business. For two years now she has been running a table where she sells oil. She spends nine hours on her business. The problem she faces is small income. 

Amelia is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 40 year old, and she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

She did not go to school, and she grew up in the rural area of Sanniquelle. She is married, and her husband is a carpenter. They have six children between  7 and 22. She says that two of her children are in school and live at home. 

She received small money from her husband to establish her business. Seven years now she has been running a small local shop where she sells palm oil, salt, pepper, vita, etc. She spends 10 hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. The problem she faces is small income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, vita, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, vita, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man with a family of four people. He operates a waragi (local brew) trade business as a major source of income to support the family and he has been in this business since 2012. Robert and his wife are also peasant farmers, mainly in sugar cane, maize and growing of other food crops for both commercial and home consumption. From the waragi and agriculture businesses he has managed to put up a semi-permanent residential house for the family and pay school fees for the children. His major challenges include the changing seasonality affecting his farming.

Robert approached Ugafode for a loan of 500,000 shillings to buy construction materials to complete his house. He hopes to pay back the loan using proceeds from the waragi trade business.

In the photograph is Robert and his wife.

loans.use: To complete constructing his house.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs including food, health, clothing, and education.  She and her husband have done agricultural work for many years. She grows different vegetables and fruits, and sells them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Asmat applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR in order to purchase different types of seeds, insecticides, and pesticides. This would help her grow more crops and ultimately help in generating more cash. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, insecticides, and pesticides

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Lleva 15 años dedicándose a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y, hoy en día posee cultivos de diferentes productos, labor que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, los cuales  obtiene como resultado de la venta de la cosecha. Trabaja solo, de Lunes a Sábado y su jornada comienza a las 5:00 am. El cliente es un hombre activo y pujante, trabaja con esmero para sacar adelante a su hijo, quien es su principal motivación para seguir avanzando. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y fungicidas), para darle continuidad a su negocio y recoger una cosecha más productiva, con frutos de muy buena calidad, que permita venderlos a mejor precio en el mercado y aumentar el margen de ganancia. Es así como Luis desea mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecer a su hijo una excelente educación y mejorar el nivel de vida, generando una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Luis, 40, is single and has a son, 4.  He has worked in agriculture for 15 years.  He learned the work from his parents and today has fields with a variety of crops.  The job has become his main source of income, which he earns from selling his harvest.  He works alone Monday through Saturday, starting at 5 a.m.

Luis is an active and thriving man who works with care to get ahead with his son, his main motivation for making progress.

Currently he's requesting the loan to invest in agricultural inputs (soil amendments, seeds, fertilizer, and fungicide).  He wants to have continuity in his business and harvest a more productive crop with high-quality products that he can sell in the market for a better price to increase his profit margin.

Luis wants to improve his income to give his son an excellent education, improve his standard of living, and have favorable economic stability so he can keep on progressing.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is a 54-year-old divorced mother of five children, who has been working selling clothes for four years, to provide her children with basic necessities.Two months ago, Claude changed her business and started selling household products, such as plates, knives and cups, in addition to women's accessories. She stopped selling clothes because it wasn't profitable at all in her region and competition increased.

At the moment, she is developing her newly established business to meet her customers needs. Claude has applied for a loan which will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with new items.She works hard to provide her children with necessary items to meet their needs, and to be their mother and father at the same time. In fact, she is succeeding and will keep on struggling to perfectly meet their needs.

She hopes to develop her business and dreams of opening a special gallery, where she will sell furniture made from cane.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with new items

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 26, is married to Ruth.  He operates a motorcycle transportation business and a retail shop.  He has been in this business for 11 years and earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Peter's fifth loan with KADET LTD.  He has paid all other loans successfully.  He plans to use this loan to stock his retail shop by buying rice, cooking oil, sugar etc. 

In future Peter wants to be a successful business man and a land owner.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, etc. for resell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. He has three children and has been doing this work for six years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Source of income."  His biggest challenge is, "Lack of market."  Animals on the farm have not been named.

Richard was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "low interest rate."  He was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "meet client's financial needs."

His highest monthly expense is school fees.  When asked "How this loan will benefit his family," Richard replied, "improve living standard."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Richard owns the following: cow, pig, poultry, motorcycle, mosquito net, solar power, TV and DVD."   Richard does not have electricity, running water or a sewing machine.

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land.  She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 6 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Source of income.'  Her biggest challenge is 'Lack of market.'  She wants to purchase a dairy cow.  Animals on the farm have not been named.

Linet was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It is customer friendly, low interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Meets client financial needs.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. 

When asked 'How will this loan will benefit your family,' Linet replied, 'Improve living standard.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Linet owns the following: cow, poultry, mosquito net, TV and DVD.

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, 39, is from Shiere, in Kakamega County, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family and is married to Joseph, who is a businessman and provides supports for the family. Together, they have five children, aged 19, 12, 9, 6 and 3 years old, respectively.

Gladys has been operating a retail shop for the last 12 years and getting a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. She is applying for her first loan with the Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology. She will use the loan to purchase items like sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, and bars of soap to sell. She will use the anticipated income to open another retail shop.

Gladys' dream is to open a health centre and support her family.

loans.use: to increase the volume of her stock

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Comfort from Liberia. She lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia.
 
Comfort is one those who grew up in the rural areas of Sanniquelle where she did not have the opportunity to attend school. Comfort is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have four children who live in the same house with their parents.  

Over the past six years, she has been selling pepper, oil, rice, salt, etc., from a table in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending nine hours at her business. Comfort is going to buy more pepper, oil, rice, salt, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, rice, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
The Rita's group is made up of two able women who live in the same area. The representative of the group, Rita, (standing on the right in the photo) is 48 years old. Rita went through elementary education. She is married to Ebenezer, and they have three children. Rita lives alone with her husband, and they both are responsible for their household needs.

To meet their needs, Rita procures fish and eggs in the market and resells them to customers.

In order to increase her sales and to satisfy customer demand, Rita joined with her friend to request their seventh loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

They need a total amount of GHS 3,600 to be able to satisfy customers promptly.

loans.use: to procure fish and eggs in the market and resell them to customers.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is a married woman. She has been in the business of milk sales for many years. Over time, she has become famous for providing good quality milk in her town. She also sells butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her a decent life. She is a mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. In this way she will be able to increase her sales to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nowyee

texts.en:
Nowyee is 33 years old and she live in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the county with the second largest population in Liberia. 

She did not go to school, and she grew up in a rural area of Sanniquelle. She is married, and her husband is a carpenter. They both have seven children, who are between 1 to 15. Nowyee says three of her children are in school and they all live at home. 

She started her business by selling for her mother who taught her how to make the local soap called iron-soap. She spends 8 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. 

A problem she faces is that she has little capital since she is thinking of buying others soap to add her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic, oil, and new goods such as imported soap like Delta, Medicated, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic, oil, and new goods such as imported soap like delta, medicated, etc for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the county with the second largest population in Liberia. She did not attend school, and she has lived all her life in rural areas. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They both have five children. Her children are between 9 to 16 years old. 

With the little money she received from her mother, she was able to establish her business. For twelve years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant), where she sells rice, G.B. (dough made of cassava) and soup. She spends fifteen hours on her business, and faces no others problem except fewer goods  in stock.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, meat, fish etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day move from a cook shop business to a modern restaurant business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper meat, fish etc for her business.

loans.name: Luay Group

texts.en: This group is called Luay and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  Nadia is a 36-year-old woman. Her husband is employed but receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all his family's needs. So she tries hard to assist her husband to cover their family’s living expenses. She likes to spend free time watching TV so she is requesting a loan from AMB to assist with purchasing a TV to use in her house. Taking this loan will enable her and her family to live in an easy way in their house and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to assist with purchasing a TV to use at home.

loans.name: Waince

texts.en: Waince is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for nine years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hairstyling, and facials. She is the mother of five children. Her husband is employed with an income too low to meet the needs of the family members. Through her well provided services, she has become very famous on her street. Waince is interested in buying more of a variety of cosmetic products for the parlor in order to meet the increasing demands of her customers.  But because she lacks cash in hand, Waince contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her third loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers in time. She dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 32 year old married woman.  She sells and buys animals to make a living and has been in business for many years. She has six goats.  Her business is good enough to lead a decent life.  

Jameela is a mother of four children; all are school going.  She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing. 

She has improved her business to meet her day to day expenses. 

Now Jameela has requested for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase two more goats.  She wishes to utilize her profit to support her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase two goats.

loans.name: Elmer Adolfo

texts.es: Elmer Adolfo de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica a la venta de zapatos para dama y caballero, además para complementar gastos labora de albañil, tiene varios años de experiencia en su labor y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de ganarse el pan de cada día, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque elabora  bonitos zapatos;  Elmer es un hombre entregado a su labor, desea que todos vivan en mejores condiciones y en un hogar seguro y más limpio; quiere encementar un cuarto de su vivienda y poner piso cerámico necesita realizarlo lo más pronto posible pero no posee del capital suficiente que abarque los costos de los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar  cemento,arena y piso cerámico, arena. Elmer Adolfo tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecido con la ayuda.
texts.en:
Elmer Adolfo is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son. He makes ladies’ and men’s shoes, and for additional income he works as a mason. He has many years of work experience, and that’s allowed him to put food on the table every day. He has lots of customers, and people prefer to buy from him because he makes attractive shoes. Elmer is a man who’s committed to his work. 

He wants everyone in his family to have better living conditions and a home that’s more secure and clean. He wants to cement a room in the house and instill a ceramic floor. He’d like to do this as soon as possible, but he doesn’t have enough money to cover the cost of the materials. For that reason, he’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and ceramic flooring. Elmer Adolfo has good financial references and is responsible in repaying debt. He is thankful for the help.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and ceramic flooring.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a 63-year-old widow and supports a family of eight including her grandchildren. She owns rental premises in Kabarnet Town and has been renting these for a period of 3 years, earning an income of KES 80,000 monthly.

This is her second loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD and she intends to use this amount to purchase cement, sand and blocks to continue with her construction. The profits she earns will be used to purchase more plots to develop further.

Her dream is to be financially stable and also look after her beloved grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para el fortalecimiento de su negocio; esta inversión le servirá para comprar variedad de productos, tales como: jugos, gaseosas, refrescos, entre otros.
Cuenta la Sra. Sofía que el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas y con ello obtuvo mayores ganancias, también logro adquirir más clientela. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que siempre le ayuda a su nieta en los estudios gracias a los ingresos del negocio.
texts.en: Sofia is faced with the need to obtain a new loan because she needs more working capital to strengthen her business. This loan will be used to buy a variety of products like juices, carbonated drinks, sodas, etc. Sofia says that the previous loan helped her improve sales, increase earnings, and acquire more customers. Her financial situation has improved, and she’s been able to help her granddaughter with school expenses thanks to her income.

loans.use: to buy  juices, carbonated drinks, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Doña María es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Las Hormiguitas, tiene 44 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos es estudiante de secundaria, el otro ya es mayor de edad.  Ella se dedica a las labores agropecuarias, cuentan con un terreno propio para desarrollarlas,  cría y engorda; pollos, cerdos, terneros, además de cultivar algunas hortalizas. Este es su cuarta solicitud de crédito, y son los financiamientos los que le han permitido iniciar y consolidar su microempresa, y así poder ayudar con los gastos familiares y el pago de los estudios de su hijo. 
Su meta es seguir trabajando, aumentar su producción, y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a María integran el grupo 6 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en: Maria is the president of Banco Mujer Las Hormiguitas (Women’s Bank of Tiny Ants). She’s 44 years old, married, and has two sons. One son is in high school, and the other is grown. She works in the agricultural sector. She has her own land where she raises and cares for chickens, pigs, and calves. She also grows some vegetables. This is her 4th loan. These loans have allowed her to start and consolidate her small business, help out with family expenses, and pay for her son’s studies. Her dream is to continue working, increase production, and have a better quality of life. Along with Maria there are 6 more group members who will invest in their agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, feed concentrate, and vitamins as wells as pigs and calves.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is a 31-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for a period of about 1.6 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan  to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. In this way she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Yanira Del Transito

texts.es:
Yanira, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo. Ella, posee una tienda para obtener ingresos y mejorar las  ganancias, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace varios años atrás. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos necesarios, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, detergentes, bebidas, golosinas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir mas la tienda,  así ofrecerle más y mejores productos a la clientela.
Su sueño es surtir su negocio para brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
