texts.en: Yanira is a single mother and lives with her son. She owns a store so that she can earn money and improve her income, and she’s been doing this work for several years. The loan she needs will allow her to buy necessary products like beans, rice, sugar, salt, detergent, drinks, candy, etc. This loan will help her better supply her store as well as offer more and better products to her customers. Her dream is to supply her business in order to give her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, salt, detergent, drinks, candy, etc.

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda, es una mujer de 60 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos, vive junto a sus dos hijos y un nieto. Lastimosamente, ella no asistió a la escuela, solo aprendió a escribir las iniciales de su nombre.

Desde hace unos 5 años, instalo una pequeña tienda de productos básicos, en su casa y de ahí ella obtiene los ingresos para cubrir con los gastos del hogar. De igual manera, ella se dedica al cuido de ganado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maíz, frijol, entre otros productos para la tienda y para el cuido de su ganado. Su propósito es, hacer crecer su negocio cada día más, ir invirtiendo para no dejarlo caer y de esta manera disponer de dinero para brindarles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda is a 60 year old single mother with two children. She lives with her children and a grandson. Sadly, she didn’t attend school, and she only knows how to write the initials of her name. Five years ago she opened a small store in her home to sell basic products. This way she’s able to earn money to cover household costs. She also tends to cattle. 

The loan she’s asking for is to buy corn, beans, and other products for her store and to care for her cattle. She wants to continue growing her business every day, investing in it so that it doesn’t fail. Then she’ll have enough money to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and other products and to care for her cattle.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is 19-year-old single lady. She has been in the business of sewing gloves for many years. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Her brother is employed in a power loom factory but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.

Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy stock of threads along with packs of buttons, needles and elastic. So then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She is on her second loan and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to grow her business and wishes to spend part of its profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads along with the packs of buttons, needles and elastic.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 26-year-old married woman; she has had a business selling milk for many years. She has 1 calf and 1 cow in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life.

She has two children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, food and clothing. She has improved her business enough to meet the day to day expenses of life. She is happily running her business through support of it.

Now she has requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase her total production capacity of milk which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce in available land. She has five children and has been doing this work for 35 years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea and crops.

What Cicilia enjoys most about her work is farming maize, wheat and coffee. Her biggest challenge is a lack of capital. Animals on the farm have been given the names Kirauni and maridadi (which some sources translate as "crown" and "conceited").

Cicilia chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of its lower interest rates. During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she says she learned how to save.

Cicilia’s highest monthly costs are family expenses. She says this loan will benefit her family by improving their lives.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Cicilia owns cows and poultry but not a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile.

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Cicilia has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años de edad, esta acompañada y posee dos hijos. Ella junto a su compañero de vida se dedican a comercializar con mariscos, que extraen con su equipo de pesca del mar en horas nocturnas. Esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace unos 6 años, la aprendieron de sus padres; debido a que el lugar en donde viven es la zona costera del país, en donde la principal actividad de sus pobladores es la pesca.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 3 redes de pesca, por la razón que las que posee están bien dañadas y cada vez que pescan se le rompen y deben pagar para que las remienden generándole gastos extras y pérdida de tiempo.

Su objetivo es, adquirir un equipo de pesca más, a fin de hacer crecer su actividad generadora de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old; she has a partner and two children. She and her partner sell seafood which they harvest with their equipment at night. She’s been developing this business over 6 years, and she was taught by her parents. They live in a coastal region of the country where most people are fishermen. 

The loan she’s asking for is to buy three fishnets since the ones they have are damaged. Every time they go out to fish, the fishnets break and must be mended which costs time and money. 

Her goal is to have more fishing equipment, to grow her business, and to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy three fishnets.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Campo Group

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana, es madre soltera, de 30 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negocio sembrando una cuerda de terreno y hasta la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para su siembra de café, desea en el futuro tener mas cuerdas de terreno para sembrar más café y obtener mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la seimbra de café maíz y frijol, otras se dedican a tejer cortes y guipiles. Dos integrantes del grupo no pudieron asistir a la reunion cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Fabiana is a 30 year-old single mother who did not have an opportunity to get an education.  She has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school.  She works in agriculture, and she started this business cultivating a cuerda (less than half an acre) of land.  Up until now, she has 7 years of experience.  She relies on the support of her family.

She is organizing a communal bank and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her coffee plants.  In the future, she wants to have more land so that she can cultivate more coffee and obtain better earnings.  Some of the other members of this group cultivate coffee, corn and beans, and others work weaving traditional skirts and blouses.  Two members of the group were not able to attend the meeting when this photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to cultivate coffee

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of buying and selling animals for the past 10 years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices, near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life.  She has four children; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life.

This is her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 30,000, which she will use to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats, to raise in time for Eid-ul-Azha feasts.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is 47 years old, a married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for the past four years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 34 years old. He is married with four children aged between 2 and 11. He has been a rice farmer for the past fifteen years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. He plans to use the profits for building a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Sughraan

texts.en:
Sughraan is 43 years old, a married woman, and has five children. She has been weaving sweaters for about 10 years. She works hard on her weaving every day so she can earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. 

Recently, Sughraan contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000, which she will use to purchase bundles of wool and thread in different colors. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and thread in different colors.

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en:
Bashira is a 43-year-old married woman. She has efficiently run her business of milk sales for many years. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of milking them while her husband sells the milk door-to-door on a daily basis. By now she has become famous in her town for providing good quality milk. She is also involved in the business of animal sales to generate extra income.

 In order to increase milk sales, Bashira needs to purchase another buffalo. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for five years and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to increase her total production capacity of milk which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ruqya

texts.en:
Ruqya is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. For about 13 years she is been working at hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

Ruqya dreams of her children's bright future. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Jaime Ofilio

texts.es:
Jaime de 31 años de edad. Estudio hasta octavo grado, no pudo continuar porque la pobreza de su familia lo  obligo a emigrar hacia Estados Unidos, de donde hace 5 años lo deportaron y se a tenido que dedicar  a cultivar la tierra. Esta acompañado y su señora  realiza oficios domésticos. Tienen un niño de 1 año de edad. Con ellos viven: su mamá y dos sobrinas.

Él aprendió trabajando con su padre, aparte de cultivar, tiene dos vacas que espera ir mejorando  sus condiciones a medida vaya creciendo su ganado. Pero su milpa se encuentra bastante retirado y tiene que viajar aproximadamente de 8 km  en bicicleta.

Necesita el dinero para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que manifiesta que le toca bastante pesado tener que pedalear  su bicicleta tan grande distancia y hacer esto todos los días.

Con el préstamo dispondrá de un medio de transporte que le permita ser mas eficiente en sus labores y tener mas tiempo para trabajar y también para su familia.

Su sueño es poder comprar una parcela cerca de su casa  y no tener que viajar tan lejos, teniendo donde cultivar y dedicarse un poco a la crianza de ganado, esta seguro que no es necesario tener que emigrar a otros países, si aquí en su país puede hacer su vida dignamente.
texts.en:
Jaime, 31, studied until 8th grade. He could not continue because the poverty of his family obliged him to emigrate to the US, from where he was deported 5 years ago. He has had to earn his living cultivating the earth. He is accompanied by his wife who carries out housework. They have one son who is one year old. With them live his mother and two nieces.

He learned working with his father. Apart from growing crops, he has two cows that he hopes improve his conditions as they grow. But his farm is fairly far away and he has to travel approximately 8 km by bicycle.

He needs the money to buy a motorcycle, given that it's very difficult to have to pedal his bicycle such a long distance and do this every day. The loan will make a means of transport available that will permit him to be more efficient in his work and have more time to work and also for his family.

His dream is to be able to buy a plot of land near his house and not have to travel so far. He would have a place to grow and do a little bit of cattle raising. It's certain that it is not necessary to have to emigrate to other countries, if here in his country he can make his life decently.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: 2 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2 DE FEBRERO”  iniciará el trigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, peluquería de caninos, profesora, tienda de barrio/librería, venta de dulces y galletas, imprenta, pensión, salón de peinados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de imprenta; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, cuando aún trabajaba en un taller de imprenta, decide iniciar su propio negocio y para ello se aproximó a Pro Mujer donde se le otorgó el crédito.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papeles y tinta) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compañerismo de su grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “2 de Febrero” (February 2nd) is starting its 30th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Community Center.  This group consists of 12 members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Martha serves as the president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling cosmetics, dog grooming, teaching, managing a neighborhood store and bookstore, selling candies and cookies, printing, managing a boarding house, and managing a hair salon.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Martha.  She said that she joined Pro Mujer 10 years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization.  Martha currently manages a printing business that she started years ago.  When she worked at another print shop, she decided to start her own business.  This was around the time she joined Pro Mujer and was offered a loan.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying paper and ink.  She acquires her supplies from the wholesale shops in the city of El Alto and then produces what she sells from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Martha is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Martha said that she enjoys the camaraderie within her group.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink.

loans.name: Wakakooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est responsable du groupe  WAKAKOOMA.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d‘un enfant. Il a 06ans et  va  à l’école. Mme a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend du bois de chauffe et charbon depuis 03ans.  Elle s’approvisionne par livraison  à domicile pour le bois et chez les grossistes du quartier pour le charbon. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 06 sacs de charbon et 02rangées de bois.
Elle  veut  renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son commerce et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is the leader of the Wakakooma group. She is doing well. She is married with a 6-year-old child who goes to school. She supports two people.  

Aminata has been selling firewood and charcoal for 3 years. The firewood is delivered to her home, and she gets the charcoal from local wholesalers. Her clients are men and women from the area. 

She wants to buy six sacks of charcoal and two piles of firewood. She will use her profits to bolster her activity. Her goals are to expand her business and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of charcoal and 2 piles of firewood.

loans.name: Agustin Geremias

texts.es:
Agustín, tiene 58 años de edad y está casado, su esposa tiene 60 años de edad, tienen dos hijos pero ya tienen su propia familia. El, se dedica a la agricultura, tales como cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de cerdos, dicha actividad es de familia, ya que toda la vida se han dedica a dicha actividad, la realizan todos los días. 
El préstamo le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas insecticidas, plaguicidas y concentrado para cerdos. Esta inversión le ayudara incrementar sus inventarios y obtener ingresos oportunos. 
Su sueño es fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia.
texts.en:
Agustín is 58 years old and married.  His wife is 60 years old and they have two children who already have their own families.  

Agustín is a farmer who grows basic grains and raises pigs.  This business has been in his family, so he has spent his entire life farming.  He works every day.  The loan he is requesting will allow him to buy farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, fungicides, and concentrated pig feed.  This investment will help to increase his inventory and generate timely income.

His dream is to strengthen his business even more and to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, fungicides, and concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Don Raúl tiene 63 años de edad, casado, vive en una aldea del municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposa y una hija. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas. Trabajó mucho tiempo como jornalero en una compañía azucarera y al quedar sin empleo decidió emprender su propio negocio. Hace dos años comenzó a vender productos de consumo diario en su casa, como ser: sal, jabón, arroz, frijoles, maíz, huevos, manteca, azúcar, churros, jugos y refrescos. El siempre cultiva maíz y frijoles y la pulpería la atiende también su esposa. El préstamo que ha solicitado a ODEF, es el segundo ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de productos y hacer crecer el negocio, comprara granos básicos, manteca, harina, huevos, productos de aseo, refrescos, golosinas, condimentos, pastillas etc. Continua con su sueño de construir un cuarto anexado a su casa donde ubicar bien el negocio ya que lo tiene en la sala de su casa y así podrá brindar mejor servicio al cliente.
texts.en: Raul is 63 years old and is married.  He lives in a village in the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Barbara with his wife and one daughter.  He has worked in agriculture all his life.  He worked for a long time as a day laborer for a sugar company, and when he became unemployed he decided to start his own business.  Two years ago he started selling common household products from his home, such as: salt, soap, rice, beans, corn, eggs, butter, sugar, chips, juices and soft drinks.  He still grows corn and beans, and his wife also works in the grocery store.  The loan he is reqesting through ODEF is his second, and it is for 15,000 Lempiras.  He will use it to supply and grow his business by buying basic staple foods, butter, flour, eggs, cleaning products, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, pills etc.  He will continue with his dream to build a room attached to his house where he can properly establish his business, which is now located in his living room, and thus provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy basic staple foods, butter, flour, eggs, cleaning products, soft drinks, snacks, condiments, pills etc. to supply his grocery store.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 40-year-old married woman who has been operating an animal sales business for the past 12 years. She buys animals - baby goats and baby cows - at low prices, brings them up, then sells them at the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she has two cows. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is a mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them with good a education, food, and clothing.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build an enclosing wall around his house.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 56 years old. She is a widow that is dedicated to her work in rice farming. She has been a rice farmer for more than fifteen years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production. She has anticipated renovating her house from the profits that will be obtained from her rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use in rice production

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 34 years old, married, and a mother of two children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by supplying water in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 10,750 KES. Anna was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and she is applying for her third loan. 
This loan of 50,000 KES will help purchase additional water tanks needed for her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as continuing to expand her business. 
Anna's goal for the future is to own a well-established water distribution depot in the area, so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional water tanks to hold more litres of water for her business

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario del Carmen de 42 años de edad  vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos menores de edad (de 11 de 8 y 6 años respectivamente); ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos, como pasteles, empanadas (frijoles con leche envueltas de plátano molido con azucar), yuca y papas fritas; tiene algún tiempo con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas  lo que le permite obtener buenos clientes, vende desde su hogar, Rosario del Carmen se caracteriza por su amabilidad, pero le preocupa el estado actual de su humilde vivienda, por eso necesita realizar unos cambios en la vivienda que le den más comodidad a los que la habitan; ha dispuesto reparar el techo porque se filtra el agua y con la temporada de lluvia les da un poco de inseguridad. No posee de un capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar nuevos polines como la estructura principal del techo, la lamina galvanizada y pines para sujetarla. Rosario del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, con la ayuda de su esposo y la de su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario del Carmen is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their three children (who are 11, 8 and 6 years old). She sells traditional snacks such as pastries, empanadas (beans with milk and sugar wrapped in banana), yucca, and French fries.  She has done this work for some time and has gained a lot of sales experience which has enabled her to gain loyal customers.  She sells everything from her home.

Rosario del Carmen is a care-free person, but she worries about the state of her home.  She needs to make some changes to her home so that it is more comfortable and inhabitable.  She has arranged to repair the roof because it leaks water in many places and during the rainy season it is unsafe.  She does not have the capital to fix it and so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI that will enable her to buy new purlins for the basic structure of the roof (purlins are horizontal beams that provide support for the rafters in roof construction). She also needs galvanized sheets and pins to fasten them.

Rosario del Carmen has great references.  She is very responsible and is thankful for the help.  She assures us that she will be able to repay the loan with the help of her husband and from the money she makes in her small business.

loans.use: to buy and install purlins (which support rafters in a roof), and galvanized sheets and pins.

loans.name: Las Benianas De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS BENIANAS DE VIACHA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, macramé de mantas, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de repostería, venta de estuco.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, al observar a sus amigas la forma de tejido, empezó a practicar y aprendió la técnica, posteriormente decide implementar su  propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en: Communal bank 'Las Benianas de Viacha' is in its first loan cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, as part of the focus centre of Villa Adela. Comprised of eight members, it is directed by a board, with Flora as president. The members have different businesses, such as: selling salchipapas (a traditional sausage-and-potato dish), selling macramé plaids, selling clothes, a grocery shop, selling pastries, and selling plaster. This loan will thus benefit a group of small entrepreneurs. Flora has worked with the field partner for six years. She discovered it through a friend who is also a member, and who invited her. She owns a plaid-knotting business, which she started several years ago. She learned macramé from observing her friends, which prompted her to practice in order to master the technique. This, in turn, led her to start her own workshop. She needs the loan to buy more wool from the wholesale shops in the town of El Alto. After making the plaids, she will sell them from her stall. The income Flora derives from this business goes towards paying for household expenses, as she is single with two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she is very happy with the information they provide on health issues.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 38 years old. He is married with five children and they all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for the past ten years. The loan he requested will be used to buy fertilizers for use in rice production. The profits from the rice will be used to build his own home.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 51 years old. He is married with five children aged between seven and 24; they all go to school. He has requested the loan to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production. The profits that will be gained from the rice will be used to pay for the school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar mercadería, tales como: maíz, carnes, quesillo, chicharrón, asimismo adquirirá ganado.
Comenta la Sra. Blanca que el crédito anterior le ayudo a ofrecerle mejores alimentos a sus clientes. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ya que sus ingresos aumentaron.
texts.en:
Blanca is seeking a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue running her business.  This loan will help her to buy supplies such as corn, meat, cheese, chicharrón (pork cracklings), and also to buy cattle.

Blanca says that with the previous loan she was able to offer better food to her customers.  Her economic conditions and her family's situation have improved because her income increased.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, cheese, chicharrón (pork cracklings), and also to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en: Ansar deals in the business of animal sales and purchases. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  She is a dedicated mother of four. She has two goats and needs to improve her business to meet the demands of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another goat. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase another goat.

loans.name: Bushra Group

texts.en: This group is called Bushra, which consists of 3 ladies and a man who live in Taiz, Yemen.  Khlood is the leader of this group.  She is an illiterate woman who is 37 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen.  She makes an effort to improve her living standards.  She has a house and she would like to provide her family with a comfortable life.  She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge Antonio de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos uno de 16 años y el otro de 14 años, el trabaja de albañil  a medio tiempo y por las tardes se dedica a la jardinería en diferentes lugares de la zona, tiene varios años de experiencia en su labor, tiene varios clientes pues las personas lo prefieren porque ofrece muy buen servicios;  es un hombre carismático entregado a su labor, honrado y muy dinámico. Desde hace algún tiempo necesita invertir para la reparación del techo de su casa pues está deteriorado y se filtra el agua eso les da inseguridad ya que estamos en época de lluvia, además desea poner piso en toda la vivienda; quiere invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital que logre completar el gasto pues debido a su baja condición económica es muy difícil por eso se decidió solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar,cemento, lámina galvanizada para reparación del techo, ladrillo de piso. Jorge Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago de parte de sus conocidos y asegura que cancelar la deuda en el tiempo establecido, esta agradecida con la ayuda.
texts.en: Jorge Antonio is fifty years old and lives with his life partner and their two childen, who are 16 and 14 years old.  He works part-time as a bricklayer, and in the afternoons works as a gardener in different locations in his area.  He has several years of experience in his field of work, and has a number of customers because people prefer him due to his very good service. He is a charismatic man who is  committed to his work, and is honest and very dynamic.  For some time he has needed to invest in repairing the roof of his house, which has deteriorated, and his water filter. These things are causing them to feel unsafe, since it is now the rainy season.  He also wants to install a floor throughout his house.  He wants to invest in these things, but does not have enough capital to complete the expenditure, which is difficult due to his limited financial circumstances. For this reason he is requesting a loan through FUSAI that will allow him to buy concrete, sheet metal to repair the roof, and bricks for the floor.  Jorge Antonio has good payment references from people who know him, and commits to making his debt repayments on time.  He is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy concrete, sheet metal to repair the roof, and  bricks for the floor.

loans.name: Gotitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS”  iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Karina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de celulares, venta de camas, venta de frutas, producción de mantas, venta de comida, venta de papa, brostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Karina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una vecina que es socia de la institución y le hablo del trabajo que se realiza. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de ropa; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, al ingresar a un centro de formación técnica donde aprendió a realizar costura y desde esa entonces trabaja en este rubro.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en: Communal bank 'Gotitas' (meaning 'droplets') is in its twenty-second loan cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, as part of the focus centre of Alto Lima. Comprised of nine members, it is directed by a board, with Karina as president. The members have different businesses, such as: selling mobile phones, selling beds, selling fruit, making plaids, selling food, selling potatoes, and selling fried chicken. This loan will thus benefit a group of small entrepreneurs. Karina has worked with the field partner for six years. She discovered it through a neighbour who is also a member, and who invited her and told her about the work of Pro Mujer. She owns a sewing and clothes-selling business, which she started several years ago. She learned the trade at a technical school and has been practicing it since she graduated. She needs the loan to buy more clothes from the wholesale shops in the town of El Alto. After making the clothes, she will sell them from her stall. The income Karina derives from this business goes towards paying for household expenses, as she is in a civil union and has one child. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she is very happy with the information they provide on health issues.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Lucía Victoria

texts.es: La cliente vive en la zona de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Hace 10 años recibió un pequeño dinero y empezó a dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual le ha generado una cantidad importante de clientes que le compran mes a mes.  Trabaja sola todos los días, de 9 am a 6 pm.  Es divorciada y no tiene hijos.  Necesita invertir el crédito en la compra de zapatos deportivos, botas y ropa para comercilizarlos.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the District of Orquídeas in Guayaquil.  Ten years ago, she received a small amount of money and started this business that has generated a few important customers who buy from her month after month.  The borrower works alone every day from 9:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.  She is divorced and has no children.

The borrower needs to invest this loan in the purchase of sports shoes, boots, and clothing that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes, boots, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 64 years old and comes from Olkalou. He is married to Monica, who is a farmer. They have two grandchildren, aged 19 and 10 years, whom he supports.

John is in the business of mixed farming, and he has been running the farm for the past 20 years. His monthly income at present is KES 15,000. He has applied for his fifth loan from KADET, for KES 50,000. He intends to use it for buying small calves, which he intends to mature and then resell at a profit.

His hope and dream for the future is to be wealthier, so that his grandchildren can enjoy.

loans.use: to buy young, small calves, which will be sold after they have grown big and fattened

loans.name: Justin

texts.en: Justin is 42 years old and the father of 2 children, who are both currently studying in school.  For the last fifteen years, he has earned a living by selling goods and services from his general store in Malindi, where he earns a monthly profit of 26,500 KES.  Justin was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and he is applying for his fourth loan of  80,000 KES to purchase additional stock needed for his business.  He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family, and expand the current business.  Justin hopes to own his own supermarket in the future to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his general store

loans.name: Dúo San Francisco Group

texts.es: Dúo San Francisco, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Antonia de 36 años de edad, ella se ha dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo ya que esa actividad le ha servido mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, le da gracias a Dios por haberle dado la oportunidad conocer a Kiva ya que le han ayudado mucho, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo esperando que le puedan ayudar con este nuevo credito.
texts.en: The group Duo San Francisco has Maria Antonia as a member. She is 36 years old and has worked in agriculture for a long time since this activity has allowed her to provide for her family. She gives thanks to God for having given her the opportunity to learn about Kiva since it has helped her a lot. In this opportunity she is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for her crops, hoping that they help her with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for crops.

loans.name: Ana Concepcion

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 60 años de edad y está casada, tiene 58 años de edad, tienen dos hijos, los cuales ya son profesionales y tiene su propio negocio. Ella, posee una panadería en su casa, la cual tiene más de 30 años de poseerla y es de carácter familiar, ya que ha instruido a sus hijos en dicha actividad y todos le ayudan, lo desempeñan todos los días.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá  comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: harina, aceite, manteca azúcar, bandejas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es mantener y crecer en el negocio, asimismo brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children that are professionals.  She has her own business, a bakery in her home, which she has had for more than 30 years. Her bakery is well-known in the area.

The loan she is seeking will enable her to buy a variety of supplies such as flour, oil, sugar, butter, trays, and other things like these.  This loan will help her increase her inventory so that she can make a higher income.  Her dream is to grow her business, as it will provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, butter, sugar, trays, and other things like these.

loans.name: Moisés Cruz

texts.es:
Moisés cuenta con 60 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijas; pero solo una hija estudia, la otra no asiste aún. Estudio hasta sexto grado en la escuela, debido que desde la edad de los 8 años empezó a aprender las labores del campo, en compañía de su padre y sus tíos. Ellos sembraban maíz y hortalizas. 

Hoy en día, él sigue esa tradición familiar y para desarrollar sus siembras, se traslada a una distancia de un kilómetro aproximadamente hasta llegar al lugar en donde tiene sus cultivos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4,000 plantas de chile para plantarlas, abonos y pesticidas especiales para estas plantas. Sus aspiraciones son, el tener un excelente resultado con su cosecha y cubrir su deuda. Así, como el aumentar y diversificar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Moises, 60, lives with a partner and has 2 daughters.  Only one of the daughters is in school, the other is not yet attending.  Moises has a 6th grade education, because from the age of 8 he started to learn to farm alongside his father and his uncles.  They used to cultivate corn and vegetables.

Today, he is continuing with this family tradition.  To develop his crops, he travels a distance of about 1 kilometer to arrive in the place where he has his fields.

Moises is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy 4,000 chili seedlings to plant, and to buy fertilizers and special pesticides for these plants.  He aspires to get great results from his harvest so that he can pay off his debt, as well as expand and diversify his crops.

loans.use: to buy 4,000 chili plants, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy tiene 43 años, esta casada con Gustavo y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Ella al igual que su esposo trabaja en el campo cultivando distintos productos de la zona como el cacao orgánico y café ya que son los productos más rentables de su localidad. Con mucho esfuerzo logra mantener a su familia vendiendo los productos que obtienen. Una parte de su terreno lo heredó su padre y gracias a ello logró comprar otro terreno de una hectárea y media donde expandió sus plantaciones de cacao. Le gusta brindarle un cuidado adecuado a sus cultivos, evitando el ataque  de las distintas plagas que afectan su producción porque anteriormente perjudicaron sus ganancias. Se inició en esta labor hace más de 20 años y ha tenido siempre la dificultad de transportar los pesados sacos con los granos listos para venderlos a los centros de venta esperando recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales. Muy aparte de contar con el apoyo de su esposo contrata trabajadores para la cosecha y para el constante retiro de maleza entre sus plantaciones. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar sus plantaciones y mejorar su producción.
texts.en: Edy, 43 years old, is married to Gustavo, and they live in a house of their own with their three children. They both work as farmers, growing local crops such as organic cacao and coffee, which are the most profitable to grow in their area. She spares no effort in order to support her family by selling the harvest. Part of the land she owns was inherited from her father, and thanks to what it produced she managed to buy another field of one hectare and a half, which she used to grow more cacao plants. Edy likes to tend to her crops and she is very careful to avoid a repeat of the rot that plagued her crops some time ago and was catastrophic for her earnings. Edy has been a farmer for over twenty years and has always faced the challenge of transporting heavy sacks of cocoa beans to the locations where she can sell them and hope to earn more than she invested. While her husband does help with the fields, she also needs to hire extra help for the harvest and the weeding, which needs to be done frequently. This is her first loan through Kiva and she is very grateful to the lenders and their financial support. She promises to pay back on time. Edy asks for 1,500 new soles to buy organic fertiliser in order to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser for her crops.

loans.name: Mourtada

texts.en:
Mourtada is a 21-year-old who has worked in agriculture for ten years, after he left school and turned to working. 
In 2008, he started his own business to improve his living and develop his socioeconomic situation.
Mourtada is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy twenty extra goats to increase his livestock and production.
He works in trading with goats' milk, and his production is highly requested because of the good quality of milk produced.
Mourtada hopes to keep on increasing his production so that he widens his business income.  He wants to make sure that if he makes up his mind one day and plans to start his own family, he can provide his children with the necessary education, which he had to stop during his own childhood.

loans.use: To buy twenty extra goats to increase his livestock and production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39, and from Nyahururu. She is married to Joseph, who helps with additional income for the family. They have three children ages 13, 12 and 8.

She has been in the business of poultry farming for the last two years, and she has applied for her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd which she intends to use to buy more chickens and poultry feed.

Right now Mary's income is Kshs. 20,000 per month; her dream and hope for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry feed

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. She has two children. Her primary income sources are crops, transportation services, and a personal business; she has been doing this work for four years.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Keeping Dairy!' Her biggest challenge is 'Lack of finance.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Raila.'

Teresa was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because she was interested in dairy farming.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That they conduct training before issuing loans.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Teresa replied 'The children will get milk for consumption.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Teresa owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 31 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past seven years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan from Kashf Foundation, of Rs 30,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread with packs of lace, zippers and buttons, in various colors. In this way she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time. She is in her sixth loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread with packs of lace, zippers and buttons, in various colors

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is 45 years old.  He is married with six children, who are between the ages of 9 and 16; they all go to school.  With the loan, he wants to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production.  The profits from the produce will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which has the second-largest population in Liberia and is rich in natural resources. The living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia.
 
Louise is 33 years old. She stopped her education at sixth grade. She and her boyfriend live together with four children, who are between the ages of 1 and 14 years. Only three of the children currently attend school. From her susu (local daily saving), she managed to establish her business. She learned business skills from her friends. Presently, Louise sells meat soup and plantains from a wheelbarrow. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending eight hours on this business. A problem she faces is a lack of money to buy bush meat and plantains now that she has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bush meat and plantains for her business. Her plan is to one day build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more bush meat and plantains

loans.name: Dayse Jacqueline

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó vendiendo empanadas y un cliente de ella que trabajaba en una compañía le acercó la idea de trabajar preparando y vendiendo almuerzos para el personal.  Desde entonces ha realizado esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien hasta ahora.  Trabaja desde la mañana y en las noches, alrededor de 3 horas.  Es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 2 años, quien vive con su mamá.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de los almuerzos que vende.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala. She started out selling empanadas and one of her customers who worked at a company approached her with the idea of preparing and selling lunches to the staff. Since then, she has engaged in this line of work and has done very well so far.

The borrower works in the mornings and in the evenings, approximately three hours. She is a single parent and has a two-year-old daughter who lives with her mother. For now, she needs a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of ingredients for preparing the lunches that she sells.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing lunches.

loans.name: Alonso Nicolás

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás por la falta de empleo y la necesidad de tener un ingreso para sustentar a su familia.  Trabaja solo durante todo el día, donde lo ayuda su esposa, quien también se encarga de toda la labor doméstica.  Tiene hijos, todos mayores de edad.  Desea en un futuro poder incrementar su negocio para convertirlo en la tienda más grande de todo su barrio.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de víveres para la venta, como arroz, pollo y carne.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Fortín sector of Guayaquil. Some time ago he did not have a job, but he needed income in order to support his family. He works alone throughout the entire day and his wife helps out by taking care of all of the household duties. They have children who are all grown. In the future, he would like to expand his business until it becomes the largest store in the entire neighborhood.

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that he can by provisions to sell such as rice, chicken, and meat.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as rice, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Victoria Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas. 

En este lugar vive la señora Victoria, tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera de  dos hijas de 19 y 8 años, la mayor esta en universidad  y la menor en escuela. 

Doña Victoria es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para sacarles adelante a sus hijas, para darles la mejor educación y para  solventar los gastos que genera el hogar, para esto ella  decidió instalar en su casa un pequeño bazar, allí vende ropa de todos tipo, bisutería, vinchas, entre otros productos. Aunque el negocio no es muy grande por lo menos le da lo necesario para que a ella y a sus hijas no les falte lo necesario para vivir, ella trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijas ya que no es mucho lo que hay que hacer. Tiene más de 12 años con este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisutería y otros artículos de bazar. Lleva casi 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province and a place that for a number of years has been known as "the City of Royal Tamarinds," the communal bank "Las Americas" meets every 15 days.

This is where Victoria, 44, lives.  She is a single mother with 2 daughters aged 19 and 8.  Her oldest attends a university, and the younger one is in school.

Victoria is a very tenacious woman who likes to work to provide for her daughters so that she can give them an education and cover the household expenses.  To do this, she decided to set up a small store in her house where she sells all types of clothing, accessories, headbands, and other products.  Although this business is not very big, at least it enables her to support herself and her daughters.  Victoria works with the help of her daughters, because there is not a lot of work to do.  She's had this business for more than 12  years.

Victoria will use this loan to buy clothing, accessories such as jewelry, and other items for her store.  She's been with her communal bank for 4 years, and she likes it because of the help that is provided through these loans.

Victoria's dream is to provide the best for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, and other items for her store

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 31 años de edad, su grado de escolaridad es hasta tercer grado de educación básica, esta acompañado con dos hijos. Él y su compañera de vida, se dedican a comercializar con mariscos que extraen del mar desde hace unos 10 años. Además, de realizar su propia pesca, compran a otros pescadores artesanales, para luego vender por quintales los mariscos a restaurantes y comedores de zona costera. Estas actividades las realizan a tempranas horas del día. 

Desde hace unos 5 años, instalo una pequeña tienda de productos básicos, en su casa y de ahí ella obtiene los ingresos para cubrir con los gastos del hogar. De igual manera, ella se dedica al cuido de ganado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más maricos a los pescadores; para dar abasto con todos los pedidos que posee, aumentando de esta manera considerablemente sus ventas. Su objetivo es, adquirir un vehiculo, para distribuir los mariscos a sus clientes y darles la oportunidad a su hijos de una mejor educación.
texts.en: Carlos is 31 years old, and has completed third grade of primary school. He has two children. He and the woman who shares his life have both been fishermen for ten years, and they sell their catch as well as what they buy from other local fishermen to restaurants in the coastal area. They work very early in the day. They have had a small grocery shop for five years, located in their house. This helps them with household expenses. Carlos's partner also raises cattle. The loan Carlos asks for is to buy more seafood to fishermen, in order to fulfil all the orders from his customers and thus improve his sales. His goal is to buy a vehicle in order to deliver the seafood himself. He hopes to give his children the opportunity to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy more seafood from the fishermen.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, vive con su hija de 35 años de edad y sus nietos, los cuales tienen edades de 10 y 15 años. Ella, posee una sastrería, dicha actividad la aprendió desde hace 25 años con su hija, lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar materia prima, tales como: tela, hilos, botones, zippers, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y así ofrecerles un producto de calidad a sus clientes.
Su sueño es continuar con su negocio y brindarle ayuda económicamente a su hija.
texts.en: María lives with her daughter, who is 35 years old, and her grandchildren, who are 10 and 15. She has been a tailor for 25 years and has her own workshop. Her daughter follows in her footsteps. She works every day. The loan she asks for will be used to buy sewing supplies such as cloth, thread, buttons, zippers, and other items. This will help her improve her business and make quality clothes for her customers. María's dream is to keep in business and to help her daughter financially.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Zulma Maribel

texts.es:
Zulma no pudo estudiar, debido a lo difícil que era en su tiempo el acceso a la educación. Además, por la situación de pobreza de su familia. Su pareja de vida la abandono y ha tenido que hacerle frente a cargo de sus hijos cuatro de sus hijos de 24, 20, 18, 14 y 9 años de edad,   dos  de ellos estudian, otro le ayuda haciéndole la milpa y el mayor que no está con ella ha tenido que emigrar a los Estados Unidos, para  ayudarla con remesas. Además de sus  hijos  viven con ella,  3 nietos.
Se dedica a la venta de pan, en ocasiones pescado y mariscos que les compra a los pescadores del lugar, para ir de casa en casa en el cantón, vendiendo. se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde niña, ya que su mamá le enseño ese oficio. También, tiene crianza de gallinas y esta engordando un cerdo para venderlo posteriormente. Su hija le ayuda a vender de vez en cuando. 
El crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería para su negocio, quiere ampliar la gama de productos que vende, probar con otras cosas que demandan en el cantón. Con ello podrá tener más opciones de tener éxito con sus ventas y poder llevar el sustento a su familia.
Su sueño es ampliar su casa, ya que es una familia numerosa y hay poco espacio. Además,  mejorarla, porque actualmente viven en casa de lámina. Si sus ventas mejoran, mas la ayuda de su hijo con las remesas, espera cumplirlo a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Zulma was not able to attend school because it was difficult at the time to gain access to an education, and also due to her family's poverty.  Her husband abandoned her and left her responsible for their four children that are now 24, 18, 14, and 9 years old.  Two of the children are in school, another helps her with the cornfield, and the oldest one had to emigrate to the United States so that he could send them money.  She also has 3 grandchildren that live with her.

She sells bread and occasionally fish and seafood that she buys from the local fishermen.  She sells her products door-to-door. She has done this work since she was a small child as her mother taught her this business.  She also raises hens and she is raising a pig so that she can sell it.  Her daughter helps her sell products from time to time.

This loan will be used to buy supplies for her business.  She wants to increase the variety of products that she sells, trying out other items that people in the region ask for.  With the loan she will have more opportunities to be successful in her sales business and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Her dream is to improve her home since she has a large family and there is little space.  She wants to improve the house because she now lives in a house made of metal sheets.  If her sales improve, plus the money from her son in the US, she hopes to make these repairs in the near future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, to increase the range of products she sells, and to try selling other items in demand.

loans.name: Alexander Wladimir

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó con esta actividad en cuanto regresó desde España, en donde no le fue muy bien.  No tenía un trabajo, y con el poco dinero que aún le quedaba, lo invirtió en este negocio.  Trabaja todo el día, haciendo entrega en diversos lugares de la ciudad.  Es casado y su esposa le ayuda diariamente atendiendo las ventas y pedidos.  Tienen un hijo que es menor de edad.  Por ahora desea el crédito para invertirlo en más mercadería (sacos de arroz) para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala. He started this business after he returned from Spain, where he did not do very well. Since he did not have a job, he used whatever little money he had to invest in this business.

The borrower works every day and makes deliveries to various places throughout the city. He is married and his wife helps him each day with making sales and taking orders. They have a young son. For now, the borrower wants to use his loan by investing in more merchandise (sacks of rice) that he can sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice that he can sell.

loans.name: Theresa's Group

texts.en:
Theresa is a very hard working and responsible young woman. She lives in the coastal part of Ghana -- Teshie, Accra -- with her three children and her husband. She has been in the business of selling African fabric (wax-print) for several years. She is visited by and well known to the residents of the neighborhood. Most of the people in the neighborhood are her customers. She also supplies customers in Tema, a nearby city.

Theresa needs the loan amount of 1000 GHS to buy more African wax-print, which is highly sought after by both local and foreign people. With the loan, she hopes that her sales will increase so that she will make a good profit and be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in income.

Theresa, like the other members of the group, hopes to make her business grow in the short term and this way keep supporting her family, and for her children to stay in school so they can have better opportunities in life.

She is standing second from the right with wax-prints in her hands. Other members of the group are Selina, who has been selling wax-print for three years; Christiana, who has been selling footwear for five years; and Helen, who has been selling provisions for six years.

loans.use: To buy more African wax-print fabric to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which has a scarcity of available land.  His primary income sources are milk, crops, and personal business. He has five children and has been doing this work for seven years. 

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Weeding crops.' His biggest challenge is 'Pests and diseases affecting crops and animals.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Owino.'

William was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because they finance dairy products.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro finance training session: 'That savings show an individual's activeness in a group.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', William replied, 'We will have improved nutrition by consumption of milk.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. William owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, sewing machine, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina lives in Kapan city with her husband. She has three daughters who are already married and live separately with their families. 

Evelina for several years has worked as a toiler at the factory. Now she and her husband are engaged in farming. They keep on their farm two cows, a calf, six piglets, and a pig. They manage to sell milk and meat which somehow helps to cover their needs and care for the farm. 

Evelina wants to enlarge the number of her farm cattle, and she asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and fodder for them.

loans.use: To buy two cows and fodder for them

loans.name: Dueren Geovany

texts.es: Dueren, tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos y viven en la Ceiba, Atlántida. el trabajo por muchos años en una institución gubernamental y tenia un negocio en casa de venta de mercadería pero al quedar sin empleo decidió cerrarlo y estableció este otro negocio que administra con su esposa donde ofrece productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, huevos y otros abarrotes, también vende productos plásticos y de achinería. El negocio lleva un año de funcionamiento y esta ubicado en un local de uno de los mercados locales.  Ha solicitado varios préstamos en la institución, actualmente solicita el sexto ciclo el cual es por 8,000 Lempiras, y los va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, achinería, y productos plásticos. Con el fin de incrementar la clientela. Su plan es mantener el negocio y mejorar poco a poco sus ingresos que le permitan subir la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Dueren is 42 years old, and married with two children.  They live in Ceiba, Atlántida.  For many years, he worked for a government institution and had a home business, selling merchandise.  However, being unemployed, he decided to close it and established another business that he manages with his wife.  They sell food products such as rice, sugar, beans, eggs, and other groceries as well as plastic products and low-cost consumer goods.  The business has been in operation for a year and is located on the premises of one of the local markets.  He has requested several loans from the institution, and he is currently requesting his sixth loan for 8,000 Lempiras.  He will invest the funds in the purchase of basic grains, low-cost consumer goods, and plastic products with the goal of increasing customers.  His plan is to maintain the business and gradually improve his income, which will allow him to raise his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains such as rice, beans, corn, and other items as well as low-cost consumer goods and plastic products to stock his business.

loans.name: Raisa Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas. 

En este lugar vive la señorita Raisa, tiene 23 años de edad, está soltera y estudia auditoría en una Universidad Técnica De Manabí. Vive en la casa de sus padres que la apoyan en lo que ellos pueden.

Ella es una joven muy luchadora que además de dedicarse a sus estudios también se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden, tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran sus productos, trabaja tres horas durante el día y  en las noches vende en la universidad a sus compañeras de clases y profesoras. Entre los productos que más vende están la linaza, shampo para la caída del cabello, gel reductor, entre otros. Es así como ella financia sus estudios esperando un mejor porvenir.

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales. Lleva 4 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos a podido seguir adelante en sus estudios. 

Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y ser profesional.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí and a city known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind trees, every fifteen days the members of the communal bank Las Américas meet. 

Raisa lives here. She is 23 years old, single, and she studies auditing in the Technical University of Manabí. She lives in the home of her parents, who support her in what they can.

She is a very determined young woman who besides dedicating herself to her studies also sells natural products from the brand Nature Garden. She has many customers who always buy her products from her. She works three hours a day and at night she sells in the university to her classmates and professors. The products that she sells the most are linseed oil, shampoo for the prevention of hair loss, and slimming gel, among others. This is how she finances her studies, hoping for a better future.

This loan is for the purchase of natural products. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she has been able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, he has operated a motorcycle transport business. He faces some major challenges, specifically, motorcycle breakdowns, and muddy roads during the rainy season. He dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing himself.

With the loan of KES 30,0000, he wants to purchase spare parts for his motorbike. He decided to join Yehu to access loans, to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a single man with no children. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself.

For the past three years, he has operated a goat selling business. He sells to his neighbors, passersby, and market places. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the Ksh 50,000, he wants to purchase four goats for his business.

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase four goats for his business

loans.name: Nowyee

texts.en:
Nowyee is 56 year old. She lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba county, which is rich in nature resources. Living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

She did not attend school, and she grew up in the rural areas of Sanniquelle. Nowyee's husband left this earth with 15 children; luckily only one of her children is still small and staying with her - and she is in school.  The older ones are living on their own. 

Nowyee has been running a small local shop where she sells slippers. She spend ten hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. 

She will use the loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her plan is to live a better life and expands her business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Makanga

texts.en:
Makanga appreciates the previous loan he received from Kiva. It enabled him to generate profits he used to improve his living standards.

He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase photocopier paper and toner for his business. He thanks Yehu and Kiva for their loan policy.

loans.use: to purchase photocopier paper and toner for his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una gran joven, tiene 23 años, estudia la carrera de Ciencias Contables porque siempre le ha gustado esa carrera, vive con su madre y su abuela quienes tienen un pequeño negocio de ventas de empanadas. Ella además trabaja en un comercio como vendedora, además trabaja de manera independiente vendiendo cosméticos y perfumes por catálogo. Es una chica con aspiraciones, muy decidida y que está logrando salir adelante. Quiere recibir su título y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is a young woman who is 23 years of age.  She is studying for a degree in Accounting because she always enjoyed the subject.  Maria lives with her mother and grandmother, who have a small business selling empanadas.  

Maria works for a business as a saleswoman.  She also works independently by selling cosmetics and perfumes through catalogs.  Maria is a devoted young woman who has aspirations and the drive to succeed.  She would like to earn her degree so that she can continue helping her family.  Maria is requesting a loan to invest in her university fees.  This will enable her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is 56 years old. He lives in the village of Srashen, with his wife and two sons. Aramayis has no higher education, and after serving in the army, he worked for many years in a car repairing factory, as a miller. Today, Aramayis works as an inspector at the local forest reserve. His sons also work, and even so, the total family income hardly covers their needs, with the bills that they pay each month.

In spite of working very hard, Aramayis now has insufficient financial resources to organize his eldest son’s wedding party.
