texts.en: Madalis lives with her elderly father and her only son who is 16 years old.  She is a single mother and needs to work a lot to get ahead and provide all the necessities.  Madalis is asking for a loan though FUSAI, so she can seal the walls in two rooms, to protect the rooms from the moisture.  She will buy cement, sand, and paint, to do the work and provide a better finish on the walls of her home.  In this way it will improve the appearance and protect it from the moisture.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 39-year-old Liberian who lives in Sanniquille. the capital of Nimba county, the second most populous in Liberia.  It is rich in natural resources and living conditions, much better than in Monrovia, the Liberian capital. 

Esther and her fiance are living together, and they have three children, who attend school.  She completed second grade before starting her business. . 

She started her business with a little money from her father.  That enabled her to establish her business six years ago now. She has a table where she sells onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, etc.  She  spend 8 hours a day on her business.

Her problem is that she has too few goods to sell. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, etc., for her business. 

Her dream is one day to open a shop and to see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Mrs. Narangerel, 43 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. She has been running a grocery store since 2010. Her husband is a driver at a building company. Their elder son works as a house interior on contract with entities or individuals. She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate her old house. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they don't need to burn a lot of coal for heating. Reduction in the usage of coal has a positive impact on the environment, as burning coal is the primary source of air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en: Mr. Bayaraa, 37 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He, together with his wife, has been doing house interior decoration on contract with entities or individuals since 2007 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. This summer he began building a house in preparation for the incoming winter and completed 60% of the construction work. Due to lack of cash, he couldn't complete the house. So, he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, concrete, planks, windows and hardwood floors. Living in the house is better than living in a ger in various ways such as comfort and warmth. The family will burn less coal for heating as they move to live in the house. Coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia and reduction in usage will be sure to contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Meopon

texts.en:
Meopon is 48 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital of Nimba county, the second most populous in Liberia.  It is rich in natural resources and living conditions, much better than in Monrovia. 

She did not go to school, and she grew up in a rural area of Sanniquelle.  Traditionally she is married, and her husband is a carpenter.  They have seven children, ages between 14 and 22, she said.  Three of her children are in school and live at home, 

Meopon received a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business ten years ago.  She has a small local shop where she sells local soap, palm oil, bread, etc.   She spends 10 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday.

A problem she faces is a small income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, palm oil, bread, etc., for her business. Her plan is one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, palm oil, bread, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and lives with her family, in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She has three children. Her husband is a farmer, and she help him in operating the farm, for it is the family's source of income.

She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012, and she gained access to the microfinance services of the cooperative. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she intended to use to cover the cost of weeding. She hopes to have an abundant harvest this year and to save a portion of her income from the harvest for her children's future education. She also wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of weeding maintenance on the farm

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en: Mr. Gansukh, 52 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for many years and secured many permanent customers over the past years. His elder daughter graduated this year with a bachelor's degree in finance and is currently seeking a job. His wife is unemployed and stays at home taking care of the household. His son studies engineering at the university on a scholarship. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase shingles and wallpaper in order to repair his house's roof and walls. Heavy raindrops ruined the roof and walls. After the repairs, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place. As winter is coming close, it is necessary to repair the house roof if he doesn't want to lose heat through the damaged roof.

loans.use: to purchase shingles and wallpaper

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es una estudiante de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella vive en casa de sus padres, también comenta que trabajó desde hace mas de 3 años en una heladería para ayudar a su familia y poder solventar sus gastos de la facultad.
Su meta es poder recibirse de enfermera, y asi poder ser de ayuda a otras personas que puedan necesitarla. Otra meta suya es llegar a trabajar en una buena Institución apenas reciba su titulo de Licenciada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, ya que así podrá aligerarse un poco y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Liz is a student from the city of Paraguarí.  She lives in her parents' house.  She also says she has worked in an ice cream shop for more than three years to help her family and be able to pay her university expenses.

Liz's goal is to be able to graduate as a nurse so she can help other people when they need it.  Another goal is to work in a good institution as soon as she graduates with her degree.

Liz is requesting this loan to invest in paying her program fees so she can lighten her load a bit and keep on studying.

loans.use: to pay her program fees

loans.name: Wilber Eli

texts.es: Wilber vive junto a su madre y dos hermanas por quienes trabaja con mucho empeño para salir adelante, él cuenta con trece años de vivir en el mismo lugar, por lo que es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con buenas referencias personales. Él desea contar con mejores condiciones en su casa de habitación por lo que desea cambiar el techo de su casa, debido a que las láminas que están actualmente están picadas ya que tienen muchos años de no cambiarse. Es por esto que Wilber solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar cuatro docenas de láminas galvanizadas, así mismo clavos y madera para poder realizar el trabajo y de este modo estar más resguardados de las inclemencias del tiempo como la lluvia y el sol.
texts.en: Wilber lives with his mother and two sisters, for whom he works hard to get ahead.  He has been living here for three years but he is very well known in the area and had good personal references.  He wants to have better living conditions so he wants to replace the roof on his home.  The metal has holes in it and it’s been a long time since it’s been replaced.  He is asking for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets and nails and lumber so he can do the work.  In this way he can be more protected from the inclement weather and the sun.

loans.use: to repair his roof.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela lives in the village of San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and has four adult-age children.

To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing motorcycle transport services.

In 2011, Carmela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services, which she hoped would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used in repairing her existing vehicle. Recently, Carmela requested a new loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase a new set of tires, for better and improved services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a dairy producer who adds value to his product by processing it into artisanal cheese and yoghurt. 

However, the heating process required is energy-intensive, and Sergio finds himself spending increasing amounts on liquefied petroleum gas, an increasingly expensive and polluting fossil fuel. 

Sergio is asking for a loan of US$1,725 to help him buy a 20-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. He will use it to treat the abundant cow manure on his farm into potent biofertilizer and methane-rich, renewable biogas, allowing him to save money and the environment. This loan represents 47% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 20-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Luchi

texts.en:
Luchi is 45 years old and married, with six children, four of whom are in school. 

Luchi is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luchi has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and she has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her efforts.

In the future, Luchi would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is 23 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital of Nimba county, the second largest in Liberia.  It is rich in natural resources and living conditions, much better than in Monrovia.  She completed the eighth grade, and she has lived all her life in rural areas.  She is single. 

With a little money from her mother, she was able to start her business three years ago.  She has a table where she sells palm, oil, vita, and pepper. She spends 9 hours a day on her business.

Her only problem is that she has too few goods on her table.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm, oil, vita, and pepper for her business. 

Her plan is to one day move from a table business to a shop business. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm, oil, vita, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Zubaidulo

texts.ru: Зубайдуло житель района Рудаки. Он 56-летний сельский мужчина, семьянин, отец шестерых детей. У него трое сыновей в возрасте 23, 13, 10 лет и трое дочерей в возрасте 18, 16 и 12 лет. Он со всей своей семьей занимается животноводством. Зубайдуло в течение 13 лет выращивает крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Ему в деятельности усердно помогают старшие дети и жена. Доход с бизнеса является единственным источником их семейного дохода. Зубайдуло обратился за кредитом, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота для развития бизнеса. Он очень ответственный человек и обещает выплачивать кредит в срок.
texts.en: Zubaidulo lives in the rural Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is a 56 year old family man and the father of six children. He has three sons, ages 23, 13, and 10, and three daughters, ages 18, 16, and 12. He and his family raise livestock. Zubaidulo has raised and sold cattle for 13 years. His wife and older children help him with the farm work. The farm is the only source of income for the family. Zubaidulo asked for a loan to buy more cattle and expand his business. He is a very responsible person and promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Enkhmandakh

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhmandakh, 34 years old, lives with her husband and children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a grinding mill operator at a mining company since 2009. Her husband is a driver for a building company and uses a company automobile. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy an automobile that runs on natural gas. The car will be used by her husband for his taxi service on his day off. As their children are growing bigger and bigger each passing day, they are need to generate more income. Also, the natural gas vehicle has its own advantages such as cleaner emissions, lower emissions of carbon, lower particulate emissions per equivalent distance traveled and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Crecer” está conformada por 08  personas responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Bertha de 60 años es casada con 05 hijos mayores de edad. Al ver que los ingresos del esposo no eran suficientes para cubrir con los gastos del  hogar, Bertha toma la decisión de emprender su propio negocio, la cual lleva más de 04 años dedicándose a la venta  de productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a ese negocio a podido mejorar su vivienda. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito la cual comprará abarrotes y bebidas. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo.  La Alcancía Comunal “Crecer” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.  Bertha está ubicada en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
Crecer Group is made up of eight responsible people who try to improve every day.

Bertha, 60, is married and has five adult children.  Realizing that her husband's income wasn't enough to cover the household expenses, Bertha decided to start her own business.  She has been selling staple items for more than four years.

Thanks to this business Bertha has been able to improve her home.  This is why she requested the loan to buy groceries and beverages.

Bertha's greatest desire is to keep on working.

Crecer Communal Bank is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.  Bertha's in the back, the second person from the left, wearing a white polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy beverages and groceries

loans.name: Norberto Wilfrido

texts.es: El cliente vive en Machala.  Tiene 2 actividades, es maestro electricista y realiza monigotes y caretas para los años viejos a fin de año.  Trabaja con un amigo y los muñecos los fabrica con su hermano, que es quien lo ayuda.  Ambas actividades son muy productivas para él.  Es separado más de 8 años de su primer compromiso y no tiene hijos.  Desea en un futuro cercano poder terminar de construir su casa y también incrementar sus actividades comerciales.  Por ahora planea invertir el crédito en la compra de insumos eléctricos y materiales de trabajo.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Machala.  He has two businesses.  He is a master electrician, but he also makes puppets and masks for the New Years Eve festivities.  He works with a friend and his brother helps with manufacturing the puppets.  Both business activities are very productive for him.  

The borrower has been separated from his first love for more than eight years and has no children.  In the near future, he wants to finish the construction of his house and also increase his business activities.  For now, the borrower will invest his loan in the purchase of electrical supplies and materials for his work.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies and materials for his work.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en: Abner is married and has four children. He lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental with his family. He owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation in town while his wife is earning through food and snack vending to make a living. For the 10 years they have been doing this, they were able to support their family's needs. He has joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP to be used for motorcycle repair. He is thankful to GDMPC for gaining access to micro finance services and capital for the business. He hopes to earn more income for the future education of his children.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 22 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba county, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and Nimba is the second largest county in Liberia by population. 

She attended school and stopped at 10th grade. She is good at managing her business since it is her major source of earning. She is single and has a two-year-old kid living at home. 

She started her business with little money from her mother, which she used to establish her business. For four years now, she has been running this table business where she sells rice and oil in the local market. She spends nine hours working in her business. A problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. Her dream is to one day open a shop and see her child graduate high school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 43, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Victor, a factory worker, and mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Lorna is a mineral water distributor. She buys mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sells it per container (5 gallons per container) for a profit. She also has a variety store for additional income. The regular customers of her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

Lorna hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dinora es una mujer muy alegre con muy buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de diez meses de edad. Dinora es una madre y compañera muy responsable quien está al pendiente del bienestar de su casa y de su familia. Es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para cambiar el techo de su casa, el que es mezcla de tejas y láminas que están sumamente deterioradas permitiéndole a la lluvia penetrar a la casa. Con el dinero otorgado por el préstamo Dinora podrá comprar tres docenas de láminas galvanizadas para cambiar todo el techo arruinado y así mismo para comprar clavos y cuartones de madera. Con esto la lluvia ya no entrara más a su casa, causando daños a sus electrodomésticos.
texts.en: Dinora is a very happy woman with very good personal references from her neighbors. She lives with her partner and her small 10-month-old son. Dinora is a very responsible mother and partner who looks out for the well-being of her house and her family. This is the reason she is asking for a loan through which she can have the money necessary to replace the roof on her house. It is a mixture of tiles and roofing sheets that are very worn, allowing rain to penetrate the house. With the money from the loan, Dinora will be able to buy three dozen galvanized roofing sheets to replace the entire ruined roof. She will also buy nails and wooden beams. With this, the rain will no longer enter her house, causing damage to her appliances.

loans.use: to buy three dozen galvanized roofing sheets

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из Виноградово. Она – пенсионерка. Живет вместе с дочкой, зятем и двумя внуками. Ирина очень любит заниматься домашним хозяйством. 
Ирина планирует сделать ремонт детской комнаты у себя дома. Она хотела бы сделать монтаж гипсокартона на потолок, а также прошпаклевать и покрасить стены. Прикинув, сколько на этой уйдёт средств, Ирина поняла, что не сможет обойтись собственными средствами, и поэтому ей нужна дополнительная финансовая помощь в размере 5 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Irina is from Vinogradovo and retired. She lives with her daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren and very much loves to stay busy with household chores.

Irina is planning to renovate the children's room in their home. She would like to mount drywall on the ceiling and fill and paint the walls. After estimating how much this would cost, Irina has realized that she cannot accomplish this with her own resources, and therefore needs additional financial assistance of 5,000 griven.

loans.use: to finish her grandchildren's bedroom

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es la ciudad de Villarrica, ella es una persona muy luchadora, que esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho y a la vez esta trabajando.
Comenta que tiene una peluquería y que ahí presta excelente servicios a sus clientes y tiene los medios para poder estudiar.
Su gran anhelo es poder ser una gran profesional que sea útil, no solo a si misma, sino también a los demás. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y con ello poder seguir estudiando y tener al alcance su sueño.
texts.en:
Gabriela is from the city of Villarrica. She is a very hard-working person who is studying law at the same time that she is working. She notes that she has a beauty salon and that she provides excellent services to her customers and she has the means to be able to study.

She aspires to become an important professional who will be of use, not only to herself but also to others. She is very grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, which will help her a great deal.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees and continue to study and to have her dream within reach.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
This is Vangie. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she bought the ingredients and products she needed and was able to expand her business. Her income from the loan helped her send her children to school. She has had this business for ten years.

Vangie would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is looking forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vangie dreams for the continuous success of her business and she hopes that her children will complete their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed in her business.

loans.name: Fidelina Guadalupe

texts.es: Fidelina es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedica al bienestar de su familia, ella es madre soltera por lo que se esfuerza mucho diariamente para salir adelantes y contar con una vida estable. Ella reside en un lugar muy humilde pero cuenta con la bendición de tener casa propia, a la cual le quiere reparar el techo, debido a que las láminas se han ido picando con el paso del tiempo, es por esta razón que Fidelina solicita un préstamo  a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de cuatro docenas de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera, y de esta forma reforzar mejor su casa y también poder resguardarse mejor de la lluvia, lo cual representaba un problema enorme para Fidelina, ya que el agua se traspasaba adentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Fidelina's a very hardworking woman who's dedicated to her family's welfare.  She's a single mother, so she makes a lot of effort every day to get ahead and have a stable life.  She lives in a very modest place but is blessed because it's her own house.

Fidelina wants to repair the roof because the sheets have become rusted over time.  This is why she's requesting a loan from FUSAI to have the money she needs to buy four dozen sheets of galvanized metal, nails, and wood.

This way Fidelina will better reinforce her house as well as protect herself from the rain, which was a huge problem for her because water was getting inside.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing

loans.name: Blanca Inés

texts.es: Blanca, a sus 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, a quienes ha sacado adelante sola, trabajando arduamente para generar ingresos que le permitieran llevar el sustento a su hogar, pues nunca contó con el apoyo económico del padre. Actualmente se dedica a atender un negocio propio ubicado en la casa donde reside, el cual montó con el ideal de continuar recibiendo ingresos para su familia; allí ofrece mecato, confitería y licor, aprovechando la ventaja de no poseer competidores cercanos, lo que le ha permitido obtener reconocimiento durante los 7 años que tiene de funcionamiento. Blanca es una persona trabajadora, activa y amable, lucha incansablemente para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar, pues manifiesta que le gusta sentirse útil y su edad no es impedimento para continuar con su labor. Solicita el crédito con el fin de realizar unas adecuaciones locativas para ampliar el negocio, lo que le permitirá darle una mejor imagen y la oportunidad de atraer nuevos clientes con lo que podrá aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos. Esto le permite a Blanca seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de independizar su negocio de la casa, para lo que desea adquirir un local a mediano plazo, alejado de su lugar de residencia, esto le permitirá aumentar su capacidad instalada para atender mejor a sus clientes, lo que afectará positivamente su economía y podrá disfrutar de un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida al lado de sus hijos.
texts.en: Blanca, at 61 years old, is a single mother of two, she has gotten her children ahead on her own, working hard to generate income that allowed her to bring money home, she never had financial support from the father of her children.  She currently works managing a business she owns, located in her house, she started it with the goal to continue generating income for her family, there she offers a market, confectionery and liquor, taking advantage of not have any competitors closeby, which has allowed her to be recognize over the seven years that she has been open.  Blanca is a hardworking, active and nice person, she fights tirelessly to continue providing for her home's economy, she likes to feel useful and her age is not stopping her to go on with her goal.  She requests the loan to make improvements to her business location, which will allow her to improve it's image and create an opportunity for new customers to increase sales and income.  This allows Blanca to move towards her dream to be independent from the business at home, for this she wants to acquire a  location at short term credit, located away from her residency, this will allow her to increase her capacity to better serve her customers, which will positively affect her economy and she will be able to enjoy a better living and quality of life next to her children.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business location and expand it.

loans.name: Vasilina

texts.ru:
Василина с мужем и двумя сыновьями живет в Виноградово. Она работает бухгалтером в местном лесном хозяйстве. Много времени уделяет семье, занимается ведением домашнего хозяйства. 
Василина обратилась за финансовой помощью в размере 20 000 гривен, которая ей необходима для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в ванной комнате, а именно, заменить двери в ванную, залить выравнивающую стяжку, облицевать керамической плиткой стены и пол, сделать монтаж подвесного потолка, заменить умывальник и унитаз.
texts.en: Vasilina lives in   Vinogradovo with her husband and two sons. She works as a bookkeeper at the local forestry. She spends a lot of time with her family and takes care of the household. Vasilina has turned for financial help in the amount of 20,000 UAH, which is needed to  complete bathroom remodeling, specifically, to replace the bathroom doors, pour leveling cement, cover the floors and the walls with ceramic tiles,  install a suspended ceiling, and replace the sink and the toilet bowl.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom.

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Vicion Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVA VISION
La señora Marlena de 36 años, Casada, desde hace años posee una Tienda ubicada en la Alameda, Los Aposentos, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado a delante a su familia. 
El sueño de doña  Marlena es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando KIVA, FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para surtir y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nueva Visión [New Vision] Duo
Marlena, 36 years old and married, has had a store located in Alameda, Los Aposentos for years. Through her efforts, she succeeded in setting up and improving her house. Through her business she has supported her family and moved them forward.

Marlena's dream is to be able to improve the quality of her life and that of her family though the microloan that she is requesting from Kiva and FAPE. With the loan, she wants to buy more merchandise to supply and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Don Raúl es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. De  36 años de edad, soltero y padre de un hijo. Es de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijoles y cuido de ganado desde hace 20 años. Al terminar  su cosecha la comercializa a diferentes puntos de la cuidad y al mismo tiempo alquila las tierras para pasto de ganado, lo cual le  ha sido de mucha ayuda ya que ha aumentado sus ingresos y  tiene mejor calidad de vida. Solicita este crédito para comprar:  dos lotes de tierra para sembrar. Su plan próximo es vender su cosecha y con las ganancias obtenidas invertir en la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Raúl, 36, is from the city of Boaco.  He's single and the father of one child.

Raúl's a farmer by trade.  He has grown corn and beans and taken care of livestock for 20 years.  He sells his harvest at various places in the city.  He also rents the land to graze his livestock.  This has been a big help because it has increased his income and he has a better quality of life.

He's requesting this loan to buy two plots of land to farm.

His next plan is to sell his harvest and invest in the next planting with his profits.

loans.use: to buy two plots of land

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга уже несколько раз использовала кредиты КИВА для развития своего бизнеса. За счет получения хорошей прибыли после использования последнего кредита Ольга с мужем смогли приобрести подержанный автомобиль, но в очень хорошем состоянии. На данный момент дочь Ольги, которая вышла замуж и закончила ВУЗ, не смогла найти работу по специальности и вернулась с мужем в село, где помогают родителям пока. 
В этот раз ей понадобился кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, удобрения и средства защиты растений от паразитов.
texts.en: Olga has already used Kiva loans a few times to expand her business. She made a good profit after her last loan, and she and her husband were able to buy a used car that was in very good condition. Olga's daughter, who is married and finished college, was not able to find work in her field and has returned to the village with her husband to help her parents. This time, Olga needs a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Robilin

texts.en:
Robilin is married and has one child. She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a driver, while Robilin manages their own farm, planting and harvesting coconut and bananas to make a living. 

In 2012, she joined Gata Daku MPC, and she borrowed a loan to cover the cost of farm fertilization. She plans to expand her banana farm, for it is the source of their monthly income. She wants to improve their farm and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of farm fertilization.

location.town: Sapang Ama, Sapang Dala, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental with her two children. To make a living, she manages their own banana farm, earning 3,000 PHP monthly. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She hopes to generate more harvest for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Mi Futuro  (Bahía De Caraquez) Group

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Futuro, grupo conformado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombre que decidieron unirse para así acceder a los créditos que ofrece la institución y con lo cual esperan mejorar sus negocios.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Gladys, tiene 48 años, es separa pero de aquella relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aún vive en su casa y estudia en la universidad.

Doña Gladys después de que separo de su marido tuvo que ver cómo salía adelante y como ayudaba a sus hijos que en esos días vivían con ella,  como pudo surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa la misma que con el paso de los días y ahora con la ayuda de los créditos que ha recibido de la institución ah mejorado, empezó vendiendo solo víveres y hoy en día además de víveres vende carnes, pescado, artículos de bazar y papelería, además de helados lo cual le deja ingresos extras, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 y su hijo le ayuda cuándo puede aunque es ella la que siempre pasa en su negocio, ya son tres años que tiene su despensa la misma que le permite salir adelante por si misma sin depender de nadie.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más víveres para surtir aun más su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan tanto a ella como al grupo. 

Su  sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez is known for its beaches, its delicious food, and the warmth of its people.  Every 15 days, the members of the Communal Bank “Mi Futuro” (My Future) get together.  This group consists of 11 women and 2 men who decided to join together so that they could access loans offered by Fundación ESPOIR in hopes of improving their businesses.

One of the members is Sra. Gladys.  She is 48 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three grown children.  One of her children still lives at home and is studying at the university.

After she separated from her husband, Doña Gladys looked for ways to get ahead and help her children who were still living with her at the time.  She was able to open a small food store in her home where she passed the time every day.  With the help of the loans she has received from Fundación ESPOIR, she has been able to improve.  At first she began selling groceries, but now she also sells meat, fish, bazaar products, and stationery.  In addition, she offers frozen treats in order to earn extra income.  Gladys works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.  Her son helps out whenever he can, but she is the one who is always at the business.  Gladys has been managing her store for three years and it allows her to move forward without having to depend on anyone.  

Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to provide more stock for her store.  Gladys has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and currently serves as its president.  She enjoys the help that she and the other group members have received.

Her dream is to have a much larger store.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Dulce Amor Group

texts.es:
DUO DULCE AMOR
Doña Albina Adelaida es originaria del municipio de Tecpán Guatemala tiene bajo sus responsabilidad a sus tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y a la fabricación de cal para venderlos en el mercado  y municipios cercanos de su comunidad.
Desde hace algunos años doña albina se ha dedicado a estas actividades ya que es el medio que ella a tenido para salir adelante con su familia.
El esposo de ella trabaja como chofer transportando los productos que ella hace, gracias al apoyo de el,  ya que con la ayuda de el doña albina sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de doña albina es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientelas ya que asi obtendrá ella mejores ganancias y podrá mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de artesanias y materiales para la elaboracin y venta de cal.
texts.en:
DUO DULCE AMOR

Albina Adelaida is from the municipality of Tecpán Guatemala. She is responsible for three minor children. She works making handicrafts and lime to sell in the market and towns close to her community. Albina has done this activity for several years since it is the way through which she has moved forward with her family. Her husband works as a driver, transporting the goods that she makes. Thanks to his support, Albina continues with her business. Albina's dream is to expand her business, offering a variety of products to her customers, since that way she will earn a better income and will be able to send her children to school. She is applying for this loan to buy handicrafts and materials to make and sell lime.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and materials to make and sell lime

loans.name: Juby

texts.en:
Juby manages a retail store business. She has been doing her retailing for four years. She is happily married with five children. Two of her children go to school, one is married, one is already working and her youngest child is still infant-aged.

Juby is a responsible and hardworking woman who aims to become a competitive entrepreneur someday. With her determination in life, she decided to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000, which will allow her to purchase grocery items, such as soft drinks, canned goods and cooking oil for her retail store business. 

She knows that through this additional capital, she will obtain her goal to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as soft drinks, canned goods and cooking oil for her retail store business.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: Eulogio es un hombre casado de 64 años, Vive con su esposa en su casa propia hecha de madera ya que sus hijos  son personas mayores e independientes. Es un agricultor muy conocido debido a los años de experiencia que tiene en el rubro y como vecino en su localidad. Llego muy niño a su actual pueblo junto a su familia compraron los terrenos agrícolas que posee actualmente. Con el paso de los años la situación económica mejoró y permitió a los agricultores incrementar sus plantaciones de cacao debido al incremento del precio que suelen remunerar los compradores de su localidad. Actualmente cultiva también barbasco, palillo y árboles frutales como el plátano y cocos. Al hallarse sus parcelas en zonas cálidas puede llevar a cabo una buena producción de cacao, no obstante para obtener una buena calidad de sus frutos tiene que limpiar la maleza de entre sus plantaciones y fertilizar sus suelos con abono orgánico. En más de una ocasión contrata a trabajadores del lugar para que le ayuden a terminar sus labores. Cuando llega la cosecha duplica el número de trabajadores para que lo ayuden y después llevar los centros de venta en sacos adecuados. Gracias al dinero que fue ganando pudo apoyar a sus hijos en su desarrollo personal y profesional. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea solicitar 500 nuevos soles para comprar herramientas tales como machetes, palas y serruchos de podar para el desempeño de sus labores.
texts.en:
Eulogio is a married man of 64. He lives with his wife in their own house, which is made of wood, since his children are adults and independent. He is a well known farmer in his area, thanks to the years of experience that he has in this work and because he is a neighbor. He came to his present town as a very small boy along with his family. They bought the agricultural land that he now posesses. With the passing of the years, the economic situation improved and allowed the farmers to increase their plantings of cacao, thanks to the increase in the price that the buyers in his area usually pay.

Now he also raises barbasco, string beans, and fruit trees such as bananas and coconuts. By locating his plots of land in warm zones, he can achieve a good production of cacao; nevertheless, to obtain a good quality of his fruits he has to clean the weeds from among his plantings and fertilize his soil with organic compost. On more than one occasion, he hires local workers so that they can help him finish his work. When harvest time arrives, he doubles the number of workers so that they can help him and then take the crop to the sales centers in suitable bags. 

Thanks to the money that he earned, he was able to help his children in their personal and professional development. This is his first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial support that he will receive to continue forward. In addition, he promises to make his payments in a punctual manner. At this time, he wants to apply for 500 PEN to buy tools such as machetes, shovels, and power saws to carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy tools: machetes, shovels, and saws

loans.name: Brenda Licett

texts.es:
Brenda de 32 años de edad,  es casada y madre de tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6 años respectivamente, se encuentran estudiando educación básica. 

Su esposo es albañil, y ella por su parte, desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de ropa americana; esta actividad la realiza debido a que su empleo de medio tiempo no le genera los suficientes ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. La ropa la vende de forma ambulante aproximadamente recorre 9 kilómetros, en horarios de 7:30 a 12:30 de la tarde.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más cantidad de ropa. Actualmente la adquiere una vez a la semana; pero no le es suficiente para abastecer la demanda, desea comprar unas tres veces a la semana, a fin de disponer de mercadería variada y reciente. 

Su sueño, es instalar una tienda en su casa y ya no hacerlo de manera ambulante; con el objetivo de que sus ingresos mejoren y brindar a sus hijos el estudio que se merecen.
texts.en:
Brenda, 32 years old, is married and the mother of three children aged 6, 9, and 13 years, respectively. They are students in primary school.

Her husband is a construction worker, and she, for her part, has sold American clothing for the last three years. She does this work because her part-time job does not generate sufficient income to cover her family's needs. She sells the clothing door-to-door and covers approximately 9 kilometers. Her schedule is from 7:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more clothing. Currently, she gets it once a week, but that is not sufficient for her to meet demand. She wants to buy three times a week, with the goal of having varied and recent merchandise available.

Her dream is to install a store in her house and no longer go door-to-door, with the goal of improved income and giving her children the education they deserve.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия – вдова, она живет в Виноградово. Она на пенсии, живет с семьей своей дочери. Занимается дома хозяйством, выращивает разные культуры на огороде. 
Наталия очень давно хочет сделать ремонт подвального помещения, а именно поштукатурить потолок и стены. На весь этот процесс ей необходима сумма в 7 000 гривен. За счет ремонта Наталия надеется облагородить подвальное помещение и переоборудовать его в кухню, так как жилплощади постоянно не хватает с такой большой семьей. Тем более, что на данный момент кухни, как таковой, у семьи нет и она им очень нужна.
texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow and she lives in Vinogradovo.  She is retired and lives with her daughter's family.  She cultivates various crops in her vegetable garden at home.

Nataliya has wanted to remodel her basement for a very long time.  In particular, she would like to plaster the ceiling and walls.  In order to be able to do this, she needs a sum of 7,000 hryvnia.  

She wants to remodel her basement in order to make it livable and turn it into a kitchen, since there is never enough space for her large family.  The family actually doesn't have a real kitchen, and they crucially need one.

loans.use: to remodel her basement and turn it into a small kitchen.

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC”  es uno de los nuevos grupos que se encuentra pasando el 02 ciclo está conformada por 06 socios responsables y puntuales en sus cuotas. Elizabeth tiene 29 años es soltera con 02 hijos educando. Elizabeth se dedica al tejido de chompas y chalecos para los centros educativos y a pedido de sus vecinos.  Años atrás se dedicaba  al trabajo  domestica. En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de lana E hilos para coser. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Elizabeth es la primera del lado izquierdo viste chompa morado.
texts.en:
The "Señor Del Rimac" group is one of the new communal banks that is now in its second loan cycle. The group has six members, each one trustworthy and with a history of timely payments. 

Elizabeth is 29, the single mother of two school-aged children, and the President of the "Señor Del Rimac" group. She has worked as a housekeeper in the past, but now makes sweaters and vests for educational centers and at the request of her neighbors. Elizabeth will use the loan funds to purchase wool and thread for sewing. All of the group members are grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan. Elizabeth is at the left side of the photo, in the purple sweater.

loans.use: to purchase wool and thread.

loans.name: Orlino

texts.en:
Orlino is 48 years old and married. He has six children and four of them already have their own families. His youngest child is still studying while the other one stopped due to financial difficulty. 

Orlino grows rice for a living while his wife raises hogs in their house. He has been engaged in farming for almost 30 years. He is doing his best to earn a good income for the education of his two children. Farming is not easy but he is completely dedicated to improving his family’s living. 

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for farming and part of it will be used to purchase a pig for his wife. With these inputs and his hard work, he knows that he will produce higher yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for farming and part of it will be used to purchase a pig for his wife.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 44 years of age, is married, and she and her husband have been blessed with three children. She's been in the vegetable vending business for almost 18 years. In this activity, she has been earning a net income of PHP 1,000 per day.

Due to a lack of capital, she wanted to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase vegetables to sell, such as squash, string beans, and eggplant. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will be able to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell, such as squash, string beans, and eggplant

loans.name: José Livido

texts.es:
José de 52 años de edad,  esta acompañado y padre de tres hijos de 24, 19 y 14 años de edad. Sus dos hijos varones desarrollan actividades agrícolas y su hija a los oficios domésticos junto a su madre.  

Él siembra maíz, fríjol y maicillo, realizando estas actividades desde hace unos 38 años, su padre fue quien le enseño, pues esa era la única que forma que tenían para sobrevivir. Para llegar al terreno en donde realiza sus cultivos, debe recorrer 3 kilómetros caminando, ahí trabaja de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abonos, herbicidas y pesticidas, para desarrollar su cultivo de maíz. 

Su sueño, es instalar un puesto de venta de granos básicos en el lugar en donde vive. Que sus hijos retomen sus estudios, porque solo hasta noveno grado estudiaron, para que consigan un mejor trabajo y estable.

Además, comenta que de las ganancias que le deje su cosecha, adquirirá una vaca lechera para aprovechar el alimento que queda después de sacada la cosecha de maíz.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old. He is married and is the father of three children, ages 24, 19, and 14. His two sons do agricultural work and his daughter does housework together with her mother.

He plants corn, beans, and sorghum. He has been doing this work for some 38 years. His father was the one who taught him, since this was the only way that they had to survive. To reach the land where he grows his crops, he has to walk 3 kilometers. He works there from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm.

The loan that he is applying for is to buy compost, herbicides and pesticides to develop his corn crop.

His dreams are to set up a stand to sell basic foods in the place where he lives, and that his children resume their schooling, because they only studied through ninth grade, so that they can get better, stable work.

In addition, he comments that with the earnings that he gets from his harvest, he will acquire a milk cow to take advantage of the feed that remains after the corn harvest.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides and pesticides to develop his corn crop

loans.name: Mahmadnabi

texts.ru: Махмаднаби 47 лет. Он проживает в районе Хамадони. У него семья - жена и четверо детей. Все его дети школьники. Махмаднаби имеет высшее образование. В течение 5 лет он работал учителем в сельской школе. В последние годы он работает в Рогунской ГЭС. В месяц у него только 15 рабочих дней. Махмаднаби сейчас хочет начать животноводческий бизнес и совмещать его со своей работой. Он планирует заняться куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Махмаднаби имеет коровник при дворе дома, а также немного сбережение. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести крупнорогатый скот. По словам Махмаднаби во время его отсутствия деятельность будет продвигать его жена.
texts.en: Mahmadnabi is 47 years old. He lives in the Hamadoni region. He has a family: a wife and four children. All children are in school. Mahmadnabi has a college degree. He has worked as a teacher at a rural school for five years. In recent years he has been working at the Rogun hydropower station. He has only 15 working days per month. Mahmadnabi would like to launch a livestock business and combine it with his job. He plans to buy and resell cattle. Mahmadnabi has a cattle stall in his backyard as well as a bit of savings. He is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle. Mahmadnabi says that, while he is away [at his job], his wife will be taking care of  business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and launch his business.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
This is Matea. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, because she was enabled to buy the gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her income from the loan also helped to cover her everyday expenses. At her age and as a widow, she keeps on working to provide for her everyday needs. She still wants to help her children and grandchildren, also.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 40,000 PHP. She will use the loan like the previous one, to buy gardening supplies for her business, like wire, baskets, seed and fertilizer. Her profits from this business will definitely help her provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Matea dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business. At the meetings, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy gardening supplies for her business, like wire, baskets, seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and widowed. She has three children, one of who is working, and the other two are aiming to finish their schooling. But because of her financial crisis, she can’t afford to send them both to school. She only does farming through the help of her siblings. Farming is her family's main source of income, which she wishes to upgrade. 

Nora has been operating this livelihood for 10 years since her husband died. She usually gets an average of 50 sacks every cropping season. Half of the sacks are traded for their expenditures and the remaining sacks are saved for food consumption. Now, she is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farming maintenance and the leftover amount will be utilized for school allowances for her child.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farming maintenance.

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
This is Ma. Heidi. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to have her apartment repaired and maintained. Aside from her apartment, she also does manicures and pedicures for additional income. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 PHP for her apartment's repair and maintenance. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Heidi hopes to have more apartments and simply dreams of having a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partner/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор 48-летняя замужняя женщина, проживает в районе Хамадони. У нее трое сыновей и одна дочь. Ее сыновьям больше 18 лет и все работают, а дочь еще учится в школе. Муж Зулхумор работает мастером строителем. Сама Зулхумор швея. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев. Зулхумор в этой области уже 10 лет. Ей помогает в деятельности ее единственная дочь. Зулхумор шьет платья на старой швейной машинке и это затрудняет ее работу. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку для улучшения и развития своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Zulkhumor is 48 years old, married, and she lives in the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  She has three sons and one daughter.  Her sons are all over 18 years old and are already working.  Her daughter is still in school.  Zulkhumor's husband works as a master builder.

Zulkhumor herself is a seamstress and she sews traditional Tajik dresses for women from home.  She has been involved in this activity for ten years already and is assisted by her only daughter.    

Zulkhumor currently uses an old sewing machine which makes her work very difficult.  She is requesting a loan to buy a new electronic sewing machine, in order to improve and develop her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her business.

loans.name: Juventud Unida Group

texts.es: El grupo “JUVENTUD UNIDA” está conformada por 05 socios quienes laboran en diversas aéreas del comercio minorista a la vez brinda servicios. Víctor tiene 52 años es casado con 03 hijos educando. Víctor  estudio carpintería y ebanistería  el cual le generado su propio trabajo. Desde sus 23 años se dedica a elaborar camas, sillas, mesas y todo tipo de muebles a base de madera. El préstamo lo invirtió  en la compra de madera clavo y pegamentos. Una de las nuevas metas de Víctor es terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Víctor es el primero del derecho.
texts.en: The "Juventud Unida" group is made up of five members who work in different business sectors and offering services.  Victor is 52 years, married and is bring up three children.  Victor studied carpentry and woodwork, and these skills have provided him with work.  Since he was 23 years old, Victor has been making a living producing beds, chairs, tables and all other types of wooden furniture.  Victor will invest this loan in buying wood nails and glues.  One of Victor's latest goals is to finish building his home.  The "Juventud Unida" group is grateful to Kiva lenders for this loan.  In the photo, Victor is the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy wood nails and glue.

loans.name: Villarin

texts.en: Villarin, age 42, farms for a living to earn money for his family. This source of income has been of great help to uplift their living condition, and so Villarin takes great care of his business. He is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase much-needed necessities such as fertilizers, pesticides, and a sprayer. He knows that this loan will help him a lot with his agricultural business. Villarin hopes that the loan he's requested will be granted so that he can put it to work for his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and a sprayer.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 47-year-old married man. He owns a sweet shop near his home. He sells a variety of sweets, which he prepares in his home with the help of his wife. Now he is not as energetic due to his old age. Due to his weakness, he does not spend enough time at his shop. Because of this, he is unable to prepare and offer more sweets. Now his son encourages him and assures him of his help. His son promises that he will also help him to sell the sweets. 

Saeed has decided to add more varieties of sweets to offer his customers. But the lack of capital discourages his aims. Our field partner met with him and allowed him to request a loan after taking all the necessary information and completion of all formalities.

With this loan, Saeed will buy ingredients for preparing a variety of sweets to sell. He will buy flour, sugar, oil, etc. Saeed is very hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes into his business, his profits, and that his savings will increase.

Saeed thanks Kiva because they showed him a ray of hope to turn his business around.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing a variety of sweets to sell.

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es: Doña Ileana es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, Tiene 35 años de edad, es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de productos artesanales, anillos y pulseras de plata. Lleva dos años realizando esta actividad, la cual ha sido de mucho beneficio, ya que a través de su negocio ha logrado obtener mayores ingresos. Solicita este crédito para comprar: Blusas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, anillos,  cadenas de plata entre otros, con el fin de abastecer a sus clientes y ofrecer variedad de productos. Su expectativa es crecer en su negocio y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ileana is originally from the city of Boaco. She is 35 years old. She is a merchant who sells handcrafted products, rings and silver bracelets. She has been doing this for two years and has been quite successful, as through her business she has managed to increase her income.

Ileana is requesting this loan to buy blouses, pants, shirts, dresses, rings, silver chains etc. in order to supply her clients and offer a variety of products. She hopes to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, dresses, rings, silver chains, etc.

loans.name: Jacinto Heriberto

texts.es: El cliente vive en Machala.  Esta actividad (electricista) la lleva realizando desde hace más de 15 años, cuando empezó a trabajar como ayudante de su patrino, quien le enseñó todo acerca del tema.  Trabaja con un arquitecto, quien lo llama cada vez que existen contratos y además labora particularmente cuando lo necesitan en cualquier casa.  Su esposa lo ayuda en casa, cuando lo llaman por teléfono para algún trabajo o dándole referencias a vecinos/conocidos.  Tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad.  Desea invertir el crédito en la compra de materiales y herramientas para realizar su actividad.
texts.en:
The client lives in Machala.  His business activity is being an electrician.  He has been doing this for over 15 years.  He started working as a helper to his Godfather, who taught him everything about the business.  

He works with an architect, who calls him each time there are contracts.  He also works in the private sector when they need him in a house.  His wife helps him at home when they call him on the phone for a job or giving him references to neighbors and or acquaintances.  He has two adult daughters.

He wishes to use the loan to buy materials and tools to be used in his business activity.

loans.use: to buy materials and work tools.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Alfredo está casado con la Sra. Johana, tiene un hijo pequeño que sale con el en la foto. Los mismos habían viajado al extranjero para trabajar y juntar en lo posible recursos para regresar al país, establecer un negocio y vivir dignamente. El mismo ya tenia un objetivo que era ser propietario de un taller. Su inspiración fueron sus padres que con el ejemplo del trabajo y las ganas de superación le siguen motivando para seguir capacitándose. El mismo tiene la meta de convertirse en un muy buen profesional, ya que esta estudiando la carrera de especialista en mecánica y electricidad de automóviles. Con la ayuda de este crédito estudiantil le facilita el lograr esta capacitación que le beneficiara a el como  a su familia, ya que lo va a invertir en el pago de las cuotas de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfredo is married to Sra. Johana.  They have a young son who appears with him in the photo.  Both Alfredo and his wife traveled abroad for work, which made it possible for them to have some assets, establish a business, and live decently for when they returned home.  His goal was to be the owner of his own shop.  Alfredo was inspired by his parents, who set an example for him of how to work and succeed.  They also motivated him to continue learning.  

Alfredo’s goal is to become a successful professional, so he is studying for a specialized career as an automobile mechanic and electrician.  The assistance that comes with this loan will help to facilitate his studies, which will be a benefit for his family.  He will invest in the fees related to his studies.

loans.use: to pay the fees related to his studies.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo, tiene 25 años de edad, esta casado y vive con su esposa en una colonia suburbana del municipio de  San Pedro Sula.  Leonardo lleva 3 años de dedicarse a vender mercadería, vende prestobarba,  superglu, Gillette, cepillos dentales, resistolito, baterías, y otra achinería.  El anteriormente trabajaba como motorista de buses pero decidió por establecer su propio negocio.  Vende en forma ambulante y en su casa. Distribuye el producto por cajas y por docenas. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 14,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir su inventario de productos como prestobarba, superglu y abarrotería. Leonardo sigue con el sueño de  establecer el negocio en un local fijo en su casa el que espera realizarlo con las ganancias.
texts.en: Leonardo is 25 years old, married and lives with his wife in suburban area of the San Pedro Sula municipality.  Leonardo has been selling merchandise for three years - he sells Gillette products, superglue, toothbrushes, batteries and other low-cost consumer goods.  Beforehand, Leonardo worked as a bus driver but decided to set up his own business.  He works as a street vendor and also sells out of his home.  He sells the products in boxes and by the dozen.  Leonardo has applied for a loan of 14,000 Lempira which he will invest in stocking up his business with products such as Gillette items, superglue, and groceries.  Leonardo is continuing with his dream of setting up his business in permanent premises in his home.  He hopes to realise this dream with his profits.

loans.use: to buy Gillette products, superglue and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Karla Rosalía

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Trabaja como vendedor desde hace 6 años, trayendo mercadería de Guayaquil.  Trabaja por la mañana realizando pedidos y por la tarde pasa en su casa.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en los embarques de Puerto Bolívar.  Tiene un niño recién nacido de 6 meses.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería (blusas, carteras y pantalones) para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala. She has been working as a vendor for six years, bringing in merchandise from Guayaquil. She works in the morning by taking orders and then spends the afternoon at home. The borrower is married and her husband works at the loading docks in Puerto Bolivar. They have a newborn child who is six months old.

The borrower needs a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise (blouses, wallets, and trousers) that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, and wallets to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a retail shop that sells items such as biscuits, soap, and sugar. She also sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 100,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, and soap for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, rice, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Dúo Agape Group

texts.es:
DUO AGAPE
La señora Marta Julia de 56 años, soltera, desde hace 4 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la Aldea Los Planes Carretera Interamericana de Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado a delante a su familia. 
El sueño de doña  Marta Julia es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del negocio que posee y mejoras su negocio atravez de el microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA, FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar un Comal Industrial y Gas para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
Agape Duo
Marta Julia, 56 years old and single, has had a tortilla shop for 4 years in the small village of Los Planes on the Pan-American Highway in Chimaltenango. With her efforts, she succeeded in setting up and improving her house. Through her business, she has supported her family and moved them forward.

Marta Julia's dream is to be able to improve the quality of her life and that of her family through the business she has and to improve her business through the microloan she is requesting from Kiva and FAPE. With the loan, she wants to buy an industrial griddle and gas to continue growing with her tortilla shop.

loans.use: to buy an industrial griddle and propane gas to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Duo Ana Group

texts.es:
DUO ANA 
Este dúo lo forma doña Dora Leticia, de 31 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y es casada, nos cuenta que solicita el crédito  para su negocio de crianza de pollos de engorde que tiene desde hace 2 años, quiere comprar comida y vacunas para los pollos ya que si no se cuida se mueren y es perdida, la comida es muy cara, las primeras 4 a 5 semanas es solo para invertir para luego venderlos pero para eso tiene que invertir y espera que Fape la pueda ayudar.
texts.en:
Ana Duo

One member of this group is 31-year-old Dora Leticia.  She is married, has five children, and tells us that she is applying for this loan to support her business raising and fattening up chickens.  She has had the business for two years and will use this loan to buy feed and vaccinations for the chickens. If they are not looked after the chickens may die, which will be a loss for Dora.  Chicken feed is very expensive.  Dora will spend four or five weeks investing in the chickens so that she can later sell them.  But she needs investment and hopes that Fape can help her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten up, and chickenfeed.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Danilo José de 49 años de edad, casado con un hijo mayor de edad, con domicilio en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, es propietario de una línea de transporte  selectivo tiene 10 años de tener el negocio su jornada de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano y realizando dos turnos diarios para mejorar su nivel de vida, y debido a sus bajos recursos solicita crédito para darle mantenimiento a su taxi, brindar un mejor servicio a la población y sobre todo poder llevar el sustento a su familia, logrando mejores ingresos con la reparación de su medio de transporte. La reparación consiste en darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y cambio de llantas.
texts.en: Danilo José is 49 years old, married, has one son - now an adult -, and lives in the Chinandega department, in the west of the country.  Danilo has owned a transport business for ten years.  His day starts very early and he works two shifts per day in order to improve his quality of living.  Due to his lack of money, Danilo is applying for a loan to maintain his taxi and provide his customers with better service.  Above all, Danilo wants to support his family, earning more money by repairing his vehicle.  This maintenance work will consist of doing up the vehicle and changing the tyres.

loans.use: to buy tyres and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is living in Lahore, which is the busiest city of Pakistan. He is a gentle and hardworking person and a responsible father to his two children. His children are so young and fully dependent upon their parents.  He always keeps busy, to provide them better facilities, and he worries about their bright future. He wants to earn more money for his children’s needs.

To afford the household expenses and to feed his children, he owns a cold drink shop. The business is going on well. For the growth of the business, he wants to start selling 'paan' [also known as betel quid] and cigarettes, in addition to cold drinks. He observed that in his area, many people like to chew 'paan' or to smoke, according to their needs and demands. He decided to sell 'paan' and cigarettes, also. But he does not have savings to buy the ingredients for 'paan' or cigarettes.

Therefore, Faisal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could successfully reach his aims and his dreams could come true. Faisal is very thankful to Kiva and hopes that the Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy 'paan' ingredients, tobacco and cigarettes of different brands.

loans.name: Norely

texts.es: Norely de 30 años de edad reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de colchones, cuerina, almohadas y otros siendo propietaria de este negocio ella realiza sus compras a camiones distribuidores y realiza sus ventas a clientes fijos y eventuales al crédito y al contado. Ella tiene 6 años de tener este negocio que con tanto esfuerzo a podido sacar adelante, ella comenzó su negocio vendiendo en las paradas de autobuses y actualmente ella solicita crédito para incrementar el capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para poder obtener mejores ingresos y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Norely agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Norely, 30 years old, lives in the department of Chinandega in the western part of the country. Since she was very young she has sold mattresses, faux leather, pillows, and other items. She is the owner of this business. She makes her purchases at distribution trucks and sells to regular and casual customers on credit and in cash. She has had this business for 6 years, and with so much effort she has been able to move ahead. She started her business selling at bus stops. Currently she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital and supply her business in order to be able to obtain better earnings and support her household. Norely is thankful for the help the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to obtain working capital to buy pieces of fabric, zippers, thread, faux leather, and cotton, among other items

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
This is Prescilla. She previously obtained a 13,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time of 19,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to support her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Prescilla dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her youngest child will finish college. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise to sell to her customers, like clothing and health products

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
This is Junalyn. She previously was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy spare parts and accessories as well as pay for maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings that resulted from the loan have been a big help in educating her children and supporting the family's personal, household and business expenses.

Junalyn would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan so that she can buy spare parts and pay for additional maintenance of her tricycle. The profits the loan allows will definitely help her to continue to sustain her children's education and their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Junalyn hopes to eventually have additional tricycles and dreams of good health for her whole family. Every week, she meets up with her loan co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business, a meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle spare parts and maintenance.

loans.name: Rodema

texts.en:
Rodema is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She used her loan in buying spare parts for her tricycle. Her income from the loan helped in the education of her children and in their everyday household expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
